AT&amp;T officials who talked with transition officials came away confident the deal could survive, the \u003Cem\u003EFinancial Times\u003C\u002Fem\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.ft.com\u002Fcontent\u002F4c2d02fe-b7ea-11e6-ba85-95d1533d9a62\"\u003Ereported earlier this month\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIn the era of Trump, it seems many more deals are within the realm of possibility\u2014even ones the President-elect himself has once opposed.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The past few years have been extremely busy in the world of mergers and acquisitions, setting records around the world. In tech, the semiconductor industry has rapidly consolidated while mid-sized players like ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Femc-113\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["EMC"]}," and LinkedIn were gobbled up by larger peers. But there's still some potentially massive deals to come in 2017 that may not have even been imaginable in 2016."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Call it the Trump bump for tech M&amp;A."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Under President Obama's watch, regulators at the Department of Justice's antitrust division and the Federal Communications Commission stepped in to block a bevy of combinations that they argued would reduce competition and hurt consumers. The moves stopped ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fcomcast-37\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["Comcast"]}," from buying Time Warner Cable, and prevented T-Mobile from going to ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fatt-10\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["AT&amp;T"]}," or Sprint."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Now President-elect Donald Trump is signaling with his transition appointments and general pro-business stance that a lot more combinations may be acceptable. David Higbee, an M&amp;A lawyer at Hunton &amp; Williams who worked in the Bush administration, ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.reuters.com\u002Farticle\u002Fus-usa-trump-antitrust-idUSKBN13N2GW"},"content":["is helping to oversee Trump's Justice Department transition"]},", along with economist and Republican Federal Trade Commission member Joshua Wright. Both are seen as tilting much more pro-merger than Obama's appointees. The same is true of Trump's ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2016\u002F11\u002F30\u002Ftrump-pence-hershman-fcc\u002F"},"content":["three transition team members overseeing the FCC"]},"."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Further fueling merger mania, Trump is also widely expected to work with the Republican majority in Congress to slash the tax on corporate overseas profits. Companies like ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fapple-3\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["Apple"]}," ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"aapl"},"content":[]}," and ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fmicrosoft-25\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["Microsoft"]}," ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"msft"},"content":[]}," have accumulated hundreds of billions of dollars in overseas profits that can't be brought back to the United States without a 35% tax. Trump could slash the rate to 10%, providing the biggest tech companies with a lot of dough to make deals."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":{"style":"text-align:center;"},"content":[{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Fgetdatasheet\u002F"},"content":["Get Data Sheet"]},", Fortune's technology newsletter."]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Bottom line? Telecom industry analyst Simon Flannery at ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fmorgan-stanley-78\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["Morgan Stanley"]}," ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"ms"},"content":[]}," is hardly alone in expecting \"a prolonged period of M&amp;A activity given the more benign regulatory outlook.\""]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The most talked-about potential 2017 deal revolves around T-Mobile, the third-largest wireless carrier and the company that has added more subscribers over the past few years than the rest of the industry combined. Not only could Sprint ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"s"},"content":[]}," dream of buying T-Mobile ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"tmus"},"content":[]}," under Trump, but big cable companies like Comcast ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"cmcsa"},"content":[]}," or ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fcharter-communications-292\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["Charter Communications"]}," ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"chtr"},"content":[]},", which plan to enter the wireless market next year, may also be bidders. Possible targets for CEO Lowell McAdam could include music service Pandora Media ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"p"},"content":[]}," or struggling social network Twitter ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"twtr"},"content":[]},", BTIG Research analyst Walt Piecyk ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.bloomberg.com\u002Fnews\u002Farticles\u002F2016-12-16\u002Fverizon-said-to-weigh-more-media-ad-deals-amid-yahoo-turmoil"},"content":["told Bloomberg News"]},"."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Other combinations that have been tossed about seem less plausible. Chief Executive Officer John Legere Interview"},"video":null,"structured":null}],"fortune:primary_tag":[{"term_id":366068442,"name":"The Mobile Executive","slug":"the-mobile-executive","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":133921,"taxonomy":"post_tag","description":"","parent":0,"count":402,"filter":"raw"}],"fortune:primary_section":[{"term_id":318,"name":"Tech","slug":"tech","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":46728,"taxonomy":"category","description":"News, analysis, and insight into technology and business, including Silicon Valley giants like Apple, Google, Facebook, and our annual Brainstorm Tech conference.","parent":0,"count":36555,"filter":"raw"}]}},{"id":1890046,"date":"2016-12-23T11:56:29","date_gmt":"2016-12-23T16:56:29","guid":{"rendered":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F?p=1890046"},"paid":false,"modified":"2016-12-24T09:51:55","modified_gmt":"2016-12-24T14:51:55","slug":"apple-new-macbook-pro-consumer-reports","type":"post","subtype":"article","link":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2016\u002F12\u002F23\u002Fapple-new-macbook-pro-consumer-reports\u002F","shortlink":"http:\u002F\u002Ffor.tn\u002F2ikN2OZ","dunce":"8432334743","title":{"rendered":"Here\u2019s Why You Should Wait a Year for the New MacBook Pro"},"content":{"plain":"In 2012, BMW overhauled its ultra-popular, entry level luxury 3 Series lineup. The new models\u2014dubbed the F30 internally\u2014were bigger, more comfortable, and way more tech-heavy than the prior generation. The new editions were still fun to drive and captured great early reviews. But as time passed, the excitement wore off and certain flaws began to draw more attention, including some serious reliability problems. Consumer Reports rated the power and fuel systems of the 2012 3 Series among the worst in the industry and gave the model year an &#8220;orange&#8221; overall rating\u2014or two out of five\u2014on its ratings scale. The 2013 models rated the same, while the 2014 lineup finally stepped up to a &#8220;light green&#8221;\u2014or four out of five\u2014overall reliability rating. It&#8217;s not for nothing that car buying experts often advise skipping the first year of a new model. All kinds of unexpected problems can crop up, and engineers can&#8217;t always anticipate exactly how thousands of car buyers will challenge their design assumptions. Lessons learned the hard way by early adopters become tweaks and improvements to benefit subsequent revised models. Get Data Sheet, Fortune&#8217;s technology newsletter. And there&#8217;s probably a similar lesson for computer and gadget buyers: early adopters be damned. This week, Consumer Reports turned its sights on Apple&#8217;s newest MacBook Pro laptop line. The first major overhaul since Apple introduced Retina Display screens in 2012, the new lineup features a thinner, more squared off body, the elimination of almost all ports but the USB-C connector, and the cool looking &#8220;Touch Bar&#8221; screen atop the keyboard. The internals were also completely revamped, from the addition of sixth generation Intel &#8220;Skylake&#8221; processors to faster solid state disks and lighter batteries. Many early reviews loved the new machines. &#8220;The best laptop ever made just changed the scene forever,&#8221; Digital Spy raved. &#8220;Well worth splurging,&#8221; CNET concluded. &#8220;Solid performers,&#8221; if a bit overpriced, Macworld found. But as Consumer Reports\u2014and a few others\u2014uncovered through careful testing, something appears highly amiss in the newly designed battery system. While Apple claims up to 10 hours of battery life in typical usage, testers in the Consumer Reports lab found incredibly varied results on three models they had purchased at a retail store. &#8220;In a series of three consecutive tests, the 13-inch model with the Touch Bar ran for 16 hours in the first trial, 12.75 hours in the second, and just 3.75 hours in the third,&#8221; the group wrote in its review. &#8220;The 13-inch model without the Touch Bar worked for 19.5 hours in one trial but only 4.5 hours in the next. And the numbers for the 15-inch laptop ranged from 18.5 down to 8 hours.&#8221; For more on the introduction of the new MacBook Pro, watch: And as a result of the unreliable battery life, for the first time in the history of Apple&#8217;s MacBook line, Consumer Reports declined to give the 2016 models a rating of &#8220;recommended.&#8221; Hardly the most exclusive of raters, Consumer Reports currently has 66 different laptops of varying screen sizes on its &#8220;recommended&#8221; list, including seven older Apple models. Late on Friday, Apple senior vice president Phil Schiller took to Twitter to say that Apple was talking to Consumer Reports about the test results. &#8220;Working with CR to understand their battery tests,&#8221; Schiller wrote. &#8220;Results do not match our extensive lab tests or field data.&#8221; There&#8217;s little doubt that Apple aapl has already turned its vast might and resources to address the battery shortcoming and probably a bunch of other complaints, dings, and nitpicks from MacBook Pro reviewers. Some fixes may come through software updates, but as with cars, the real solutions and big improvements probably will have to wait for next year&#8217;s refresh. (Update: This story was updated on Dec. 24 with Phil Schiller&#8217;s comment on Twitter.)","rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EIn 2012, BMW overhauled its ultra-popular, entry level luxury 3 Series lineup. The new models\u2014dubbed the F30 internally\u2014were bigger, more comfortable, and way more tech-heavy than the prior generation."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The new editions were still fun to drive and captured great early reviews. But as time passed, the excitement wore off and certain flaws began to draw more attention, including some serious reliability problems. ",{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["Consumer Reports"]}," rated the power and fuel systems of the 2012 3 Series among the worst in the industry and ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.consumerreports.org\u002Fcro\u002Fcars\u002Fmodels\u002Fused\u002Fbmw\u002F3-series\u002Freliability.htm"},"content":["gave the model year an \"orange\" overall rating"]},"\u2014or two out of five\u2014on its ratings scale. The 2013 models rated the same, while the 2014 lineup finally stepped up to a \"light green\"\u2014or four out of five\u2014overall reliability rating."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["It's not for nothing that car buying experts often advise skipping the first year of a new model. All kinds of unexpected problems can crop up, and engineers can't always anticipate exactly how thousands of car buyers will challenge their design assumptions. Lessons learned the hard way by early adopters become tweaks and improvements to benefit subsequent revised models."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":{"style":"text-align:center;"},"content":[{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Fgetdatasheet\u002F"},"content":["Get Data Sheet"]},", Fortune's technology newsletter."]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["And there's probably a similar lesson for computer and gadget buyers: early adopters be damned."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["This week, ",{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["Consumer Reports"]}," turned its sights on ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.consumerreports.org\u002Flaptops\u002Fmacbook-pros-fail-to-earn-consumer-reports-recommendation\u002F"},"content":["Apple's newest MacBook Pro laptop line"]},". While Apple claims up to 10 hours of battery life in typical usage, testers in the ",{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["Consumer Reports"]}," lab found incredibly varied results on three models they had purchased at a retail store."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["\"In a series of three consecutive tests, the 13-inch model with the Touch Bar ran for 16 hours in the first trial, 12.75 hours in the second, and just 3.75 hours in the third,\" the group wrote in its review. \"The 13-inch model without the Touch Bar worked for 19.5 hours in one trial but only 4.5 hours in the next. And the numbers for the 15-inch laptop ranged from 18.5 down to 8 hours.\""]},{"tag":"p","attributes":{"style":"text-align:center;"},"content":[{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["For more on the introduction of the new MacBook Pro, watch: "]}]},{"tag":"video","attributes":{"videoid":"5187196650001","controls":"1"},"content":[]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["And as a result of the unreliable battery life, for the first time in the history of Apple's MacBook line, ",{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["Consumer Reports"]}," declined to give the 2016 models a rating of \"recommended.\" Hardly the most exclusive of raters, ",{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["Consumer Reports"]}," ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.consumerreports.org\u002Fproducts\u002Flaptop\u002Frecommendations\u002F"},"content":["currently has 66 different laptops"]}," of varying screen sizes on its \"recommended\" list, including seven older Apple models."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Late on Friday, Apple senior vice president Phil Schiller took to Twitter to say that Apple was talking to ",{"tag":"i","attributes":[],"content":["Consumer"]}," ",{"tag":"i","attributes":[],"content":["Reports"]}," about the test results. \"Working with CR to understand their battery tests,\" Schiller wrote. \"Results do not match our extensive lab tests or field data.\""]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["There's little doubt that Apple ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"aapl"},"content":[]}," has already turned its vast might and resources to address the battery shortcoming and probably a bunch of other complaints, dings, and nitpicks from MacBook Pro reviewers. REUTERS\u002FBeck Diefenbach - RTX2QQZ0","title":"Phil Schiller, senior vice president of worldwide marketing at Apple, speaks under a graphic of a new MacBook Pro during an Apple media event in Cupertino"},"video":null,"structured":null}],"fortune:primary_tag":[{"term_id":366068442,"name":"The Mobile Executive","slug":"the-mobile-executive","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":133921,"taxonomy":"post_tag","description":"","parent":0,"count":402,"filter":"raw"}],"fortune:primary_section":[{"term_id":318,"name":"Tech","slug":"tech","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":46728,"taxonomy":"category","description":"News, analysis, and insight into technology and business, including Silicon Valley giants like Apple, Google, Facebook, and our annual Brainstorm Tech conference.","parent":0,"count":36555,"filter":"raw"}]}},{"id":1888557,"date":"2016-12-23T06:30:33","date_gmt":"2016-12-23T11:30:33","guid":{"rendered":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F?p=1888557"},"paid":false,"modified":"2016-12-24T11:06:43","modified_gmt":"2016-12-24T16:06:43","slug":"microsoft-linkedin-wish-list","type":"post","subtype":"article","link":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2016\u002F12\u002F23\u002Fmicrosoft-linkedin-wish-list\u002F","shortlink":"http:\u002F\u002Ffor.tn\u002F2hVYy2J","dunce":"8432334743","title":{"rendered":"Here\u2019s What Microsoft Should Fix on LinkedIn Next Year"},"content":{"plain":"Now that Microsoft&#8217;s $26 billion purchase of LinkedIn is final, here are some suggestions for things that Microsoft chief executive officer Satya Nadella could do to improve the huge\u2014but sometimes annoying\u2014business network. Based on a very informal poll of about two dozen colleagues and friends, nearly everyone agrees that that LinkedIn&#8217;s database is an incredible trove of information about current or prospective employees or employers. It&#8217;s useful for finding and keeping in touch with long-lost colleagues, or finding potential new job or filling job openings. LinkedIn claims 467 million registered users, with two new people joining every second, although it does not disclose how many pay. Only one of the respondents says she&#8217;s quit the business-focused social network, deleting her account. Other than that, here are some suggestions. Fix the Interface There were lots of complaints about the user interface, which is clumsy and seems in a constant state of flux. &#8220;They keep changing it,&#8221; says Catherine Marenghi, a Boston area public relations executive and author. It is very hard to find things\u2014like support, she adds. To be fair, LinkedIn is already on this. In September, the company outlined plans for a desktop redesign, due early next year. Go Easy on the Spam The biggest complaint seems to be LinkedIn&#8217;s propensity to &#8220;spam&#8221; users, requesting more contacts\u2014a feature that thankfully can now be turned off\u2014and reminding them to send birthday wishes or holiday greetings to long-lost colleagues. Jeff Shuey, a former executive at Eastman Kodak kodk and K2 Software, likes finding and keeping in touch with former colleagues with LinkedIn. What he doesn&#8217;t like? &#8220;Birthday wishes. This is not Facebook fb people!&#8221; Kill Endorsements The myriad of requests to &#8220;endorse&#8221; contacts is a source of chagrin. No one said they pay any attention to these endorsements. &#8220;The endorsements are absolute crap,&#8221; says Yuval Shavit, a Boston-area software engineer via email. &#8220;I&#8217;ve been endorsed for technologies that I have no experience in. For instance, languages that I have literally never written a single line in. LinkedIn does a bad job curating the info about its users.&#8221; Said another wag: &#8220;I love getting endorsements on skills I don&#8217;t have from people I don&#8217;t know.&#8221; You can kill endorsements, although it&#8217;s not intuitive how to do so, and you have to wonder if they random endorsements have value. Beef up the Mobile App A vice president of a global healthcare organization based on the East Coast finds LinkedIn&#8217;s mobile app less than inspiring. &#8220;The most annoying bug is when you get a notification in mobile email and click the link to take whatever action, the mobile app opens and takes you to your home page. It should behave like the desktop browser app and let you complete whatever the action is,&#8221; he said. (This executive requested anonymity because he is not authorized to speak about the company&#8217;s IT use.) Now the Good News The social network also got some rave reviews, mostly from people who pay for advanced versions for recruitment or marketing Dee Dee Walsh, vice president of marketing for Mobilize.net, a Bellevue, Wash. company that helps migrate older software to the Web, uses LinkedIn all the time both to recruit new employees and for marketing. &#8220;When I place an ad, it\u2019s really effective especially for non-technical jobs. I get a lot of really great candidates because I can target by title, by keyword, by group,&#8221; she noted. It&#8217;s less effective than Stackoverflow for technical or engineering candidates, but she thinks Microsoft msft ownership could help there. Get Data Sheet, Fortune\u2019s technology newsletter. Google&#8217;s googl advertising products let companies buy keywords, but doesn&#8217;t allow targeting to this degree, Walsh continues. She also looked at Rainking and DiscoverOrg databases of prospective IT buyers within companies, but they don&#8217;t let her fine tune her searches the way LinkedIn does, she says. For marketing, sales, and recruiting, the ability to really pinpoint searches is critical. &#8220;I don&#8217;t want to be a pest to people, although I know I am. LinkedIn helps me be a pest to the right people,&#8221; Walsh tells Fortune. Marketers can embed LinkedIn code on their websites which then provides them with the LinkedIn profile of any visitor, a very common usage of the product. The reports on web site visitors that LinkedIn provides are very useful, several marketing executives said. For more on Microsoft-LinkedIn, watch: The thing about LinkedIn for many users is that it cuts both ways. &#8220;I don&#8217;t like that LinkedIn will tell people when I&#8217;ve stalked them. Though, I do like knowing who is stalking me,&#8221; says Jennifer Cloer, founder of reTHINKit PR in Portland Oregon. She got back to Fortune later to note that she learned how to switch her privacy settings to incognito, so she can stalk people surreptitiously going forward. LinkedIn&#8217;s strength lies in the data it holds on millions of people. But that can lead to problems: How does it surface the most relevant stuff and promote interaction without bombarding people with minutia? And now that Microsoft plans to integrate LinkedIn with Office, Outlook and other tentpole products, as noted by LinkedIn chief executive Jeff Weiner, it must also weigh concerns of users about exposing so much of their information to a broader audience. It may be great for Microsoft Dynamics CRM users who want to pump possible leads into their sales application, but may also turn off users who can vote with their feet to turn off the network if it gets too obtrusive. If you love the sponsored content you now see in LinkedIn, you may rejoice that you&#8217;ll soon see it across Microsoft properties going forward. But, if you find it pointless, you may not be happy. And finally, while no one brought this up, given that LinkedIn had to reset 55,000 passwords for users of its Lynda.com online education site early this week, it seems the company and its new parent have work to do on the security front. But then again, who doesn&#8217;t?","rendered":"\u003Cp\u003ENow that Microsoft&#8217;s \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2016\u002F06\u002F13\u002Fmicrosoft-buying-linkedin\u002F\"\u003E$26 billion purchase of LinkedIn\u003C\u002Fa\u003E is \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2016\u002F12\u002F08\u002Fsatya-nadella-microsoft-linkedin\u002F\"\u003Efinal\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, here are some suggestions for things that Microsoft chief executive officer Satya Nadella could do to improve the huge\u2014but sometimes annoying\u2014business network.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EBased on a \u003Cem\u003Every\u003C\u002Fem\u003E informal poll of about two dozen colleagues and friends, nearly everyone agrees that that LinkedIn&#8217;s database is an incredible trove of information about current or prospective employees or employers. It&#8217;s useful for finding and keeping in touch with long-lost colleagues, or finding potential new job or filling job openings. \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fpress.linkedin.com\u002Fabout-linkedin\"\u003ELinkedIn claims 467 million registered users,\u003C\u002Fa\u003E with two new people joining every second, although it does not disclose how many pay.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EOnly one of the respondents says she&#8217;s quit the business-focused social network, deleting her account. Other than that, here are some suggestions.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003EFix the Interface\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThere were lots of complaints about the user interface, which is clumsy and seems in a constant state of flux.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;They keep changing it,&#8221; says Catherine Marenghi, a Boston area public relations executive and author. It is very hard to find things\u2014like support, she adds.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ETo be fair, LinkedIn is already on this. In September, the company \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fblog.linkedin.com\u002F2016\u002F09\u002F22\u002Faccelerating-LinkedIn-vision\"\u003Eoutlined plans\u003C\u002Fa\u003E for a desktop redesign, due early next year.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003EGo Easy on the Spam\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe biggest complaint seems to be LinkedIn&#8217;s propensity to &#8220;spam&#8221; users, requesting more contacts\u2014a feature that thankfully can now be turned off\u2014and reminding them to send birthday wishes or holiday greetings to long-lost colleagues.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EJeff Shuey, a former executive at Eastman Kodak \u003Cspan class=\"tickershortcode quotecard_hook unprocessed neutral\" data-symbol=\"kodk\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"wrapper trend-wrapper\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003Ca class=\"exit_trigger_set\" href=\"\u002Fcompany\u002Fkodk\u002F\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"ticker\"\u003Ekodk\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"change percent\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E and K2 Software, likes finding and keeping in touch with former colleagues with LinkedIn. What he doesn&#8217;t like? &#8220;Birthday wishes. This is not Facebook \u003Cspan class=\"tickershortcode quotecard_hook unprocessed neutral\" data-symbol=\"fb\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"wrapper trend-wrapper\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003Ca class=\"exit_trigger_set\" href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Ffacebook-157\u002F\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"ticker\"\u003Efb\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"change percent\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E people!&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003EKill Endorsements\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe myriad of requests to &#8220;endorse&#8221; contacts is a source of chagrin. No one said they pay any attention to these endorsements.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;The endorsements are absolute crap,&#8221; says Yuval Shavit, a Boston-area software engineer via email. &#8220;I&#8217;ve been endorsed for technologies that I have no experience in. For instance, languages that I have literally never written a single line in. LinkedIn does a bad job curating the info about its users.&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ESaid another wag: &#8220;I love getting endorsements on skills I don&#8217;t have from people I don&#8217;t know.&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EYou can \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Flifehacker.com\u002Fturn-off-linkedins-annoying-endorsements-1560793748\"\u003Ekill endorsements\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, although it&#8217;s not intuitive how to do so, and you have to wonder if they random endorsements have value.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003EBeef up the Mobile App\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EA vice president of a global healthcare organization based on the East Coast finds LinkedIn&#8217;s mobile app less than inspiring.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;The most annoying bug is when you get a notification in mobile email and click the link to take whatever action, the mobile app opens and takes you to your home page. It should behave like the desktop browser app and let you complete whatever the action is,&#8221; he said. (This executive requested anonymity because he is not authorized to speak about the company&#8217;s IT use.)\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003ENow the Good News\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe social network also got some rave reviews, mostly from people who pay for advanced versions for recruitment or marketing\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EDee Dee Walsh, vice president of marketing for\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.mobilize.net\u002F\"\u003E Mobilize.ne\u003C\u002Fa\u003Et, a Bellevue, Wash. company that helps migrate older software to the Web, uses LinkedIn all the time both to recruit new employees and for marketing.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;When I place an ad, it\u2019s really effective especially for non-technical jobs. I get a lot of really great candidates because I can target by title, by keyword, by group,&#8221; she noted. It&#8217;s less effective than \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2016\u002F12\u002F08\u002Fsatya-nadella-microsoft-linkedin\u002F\"\u003EStackoverflow\u003C\u002Fa\u003E for technical or engineering candidates, but she thinks Microsoft \u003Cspan class=\"tickershortcode quotecard_hook unprocessed neutral\" data-symbol=\"msft\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"wrapper trend-wrapper\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003Ca class=\"exit_trigger_set\" href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fmicrosoft-25\u002F\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"ticker\"\u003Emsft\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"change percent\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E ownership could help there.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align:center;\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Fgetdatasheet\u002F\"\u003EGet Data Sheet\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, Fortune\u2019s technology newsletter.\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EGoogle&#8217;s \u003Cspan class=\"tickershortcode quotecard_hook unprocessed neutral\" data-symbol=\"googl\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"wrapper trend-wrapper\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003Ca class=\"exit_trigger_set\" href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Falphabet-36\u002F\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"ticker\"\u003Egoogl\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"change percent\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E advertising products let companies buy keywords, but doesn&#8217;t allow targeting to this degree, Walsh continues. She also looked at \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.rainkingonline.com\u002F\"\u003ERainking\u003C\u002Fa\u003E and \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fdiscoverorg.com\u002F\"\u003EDiscoverOrg\u003C\u002Fa\u003E databases of prospective IT buyers within companies, but they don&#8217;t let her fine tune her searches the way LinkedIn does, she says.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EFor marketing, sales, and recruiting, the ability to really pinpoint searches is critical. &#8220;I don&#8217;t want to be a pest to people, although I know I am. LinkedIn helps me be a pest to the right people,&#8221; Walsh tells \u003Cem\u003EFortune\u003C\u002Fem\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EMarketers can embed LinkedIn code on their websites which then provides them with the LinkedIn profile of any visitor, a very common usage of the product. The reports on web site visitors that LinkedIn provides are very useful, several marketing executives said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align:center;\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003EFor more on both ways.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;I don&#8217;t like that LinkedIn will tell people when I&#8217;ve stalked them. Though, I do like knowing who is stalking me,&#8221; says Jennifer Cloer, founder of reTHINKit PR in Portland Oregon. She got back to \u003Cem\u003EFortune\u003C\u002Fem\u003E later to note that she learned how to switch her privacy settings to incognito, so she can stalk people surreptitiously going forward.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ELinkedIn&#8217;s strength lies in the data it holds on millions of people. But that can lead to problems: How does it surface the most relevant stuff and promote interaction without bombarding people with minutia?\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAnd now that Microsoft plans to integrate LinkedIn with Office, Outlook and other tentpole products, as noted by LinkedIn \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.linkedin.com\u002Fpulse\u002Flinkedin-microsoft-our-next-play-begins-jeff-weiner\"\u003Echief executive Jeff Weiner\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, it must also weigh concerns of users about exposing so much of their information to a broader audience. It may be great for Microsoft Dynamics CRM users who want to pump possible leads into their sales application, but may also turn off users who can vote with their feet to turn off the network if it gets too obtrusive.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIf you love the sponsored content you now see in LinkedIn, you may rejoice that you&#8217;ll soon see it across Microsoft properties going forward. But, if you find it pointless, you may not be happy.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAnd finally, while no one brought this up, given that LinkedIn had to reset 55,000 passwords for users of its \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2016\u002F12\u002F19\u002Fmicrosoft-linkedin-lynda-data-breach\u002F\"\u003ELynda.com online education site\u003C\u002Fa\u003E early this week, it seems the company and its new parent have work to do on the security front.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EBut then again, who doesn&#8217;t?\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Now that Microsoft's ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2016\u002F06\u002F13\u002Fmicrosoft-buying-linkedin\u002F"},"content":["$26 billion purchase of LinkedIn"]}," is ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2016\u002F12\u002F08\u002Fsatya-nadella-microsoft-linkedin\u002F"},"content":["final"]},", here are some suggestions for things that Microsoft chief executive officer Satya Nadella could do to improve the huge\u2014but sometimes annoying\u2014business network."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Based on a ",{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["very"]}," informal poll of about two dozen colleagues and friends, nearly everyone agrees that that LinkedIn's database is an incredible trove of information about current or prospective employees or employers. LinkedIn Needs Interface Upgrades and Kill Endorsements","mt_seo_description":"Microsoft please fix LinkedIn's interface, kill endorsements, and some other suggestions on how to improve the business (l. to r.)","credit":"Microsoft","description":"","title":"microsoft linkedin"},"video":null,"structured":null}],"fortune:primary_tag":[{"term_id":42751983,"name":"PointCloud","slug":"pointcloud","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":143855,"taxonomy":"post_tag","description":"","parent":0,"count":578,"filter":"raw"}],"fortune:primary_section":[{"term_id":318,"name":"Tech","slug":"tech","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":46728,"taxonomy":"category","description":"News, analysis, and insight into technology and business, including Silicon Valley giants like Apple, Google, Facebook, and our annual Brainstorm Tech conference.","parent":0,"count":36555,"filter":"raw"}]}},{"id":1889814,"date":"2016-12-22T21:15:06","date_gmt":"2016-12-23T02:15:06","guid":{"rendered":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F?p=1889814"},"paid":false,"modified":"2016-12-23T10:43:15","modified_gmt":"2016-12-23T15:43:15","slug":"donald-trump-lockheed-f35-fighter-boeing-twitter","type":"post","subtype":"article","link":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2016\u002F12\u002F22\u002Fdonald-trump-lockheed-f35-fighter-boeing-twitter\u002F","shortlink":"http:\u002F\u002Ffor.tn\u002F2hNHgEi","dunce":"8432334743","title":{"rendered":"Donald Trump Piles Twitter Pressure on Lockheed"},"content":{"plain":"U.S. President-elect Donald Trump heaped pressure on Lockheed Martin lmt on Thursday, saying he viewed costs for the aerospace company&#8217;s F-35 fighter as too high and had asked Boeing ba to offer a price for an older aircraft that lacks the same stealth capabilities. Trump posted his Twitter message a day after the president-elect met with the chief executives of both aerospace companies, using the bully pulpit to press them on projects he says are too expensive. In after-hours trading following Trump&#8217;s tweet, Lockheed shares fell 2 percent and Boeing&#8217;s rose 0.7%. &#8220;Based on the tremendous cost and cost overruns of the Lockheed Martin F-35, I have asked Boeing to price-out a comparable F-18 Super Hornet!&#8221; Trump said. Lockheed declined to comment. The F-35 program is a critical sales generator for the company, accounting for 20 percent of last year&#8217;s revenue of $46.1 billion. The Pentagon did not immediately respond to a request for comment. Boeing spokesman Todd Blecher said in an email that the company was committed to providing the capability and affordability to meet national security needs. While the F-35 program has been dogged by problems and costs have escalated to an estimated $379 billion, it is significantly newer than the F-18, which does not have the same stealth capabilities. &#8220;They&#8217;re two completely different aircraft from different generations,&#8221; said Phillip Carter, a senior fellow at the Center for a New American Security, a Washington-based think tank. &#8220;It&#8217;s like comparing an old jeep to a Humvee.&#8221; Dan Grazier of the Project on Government Oversight, a nonprofit that investigates government contractors, said the F-35&#8217;s stealth capabilities drove the cost up, but its usefulness had not yet been demonstrated. He said canceling the program, however, would be &#8220;disruptive.&#8221; On the campaign trail, Trump touted his negotiating skills as a businessman, and he appears to be using similar tactics as he prepares to take office on Jan. 20. It was not clear how his blunt style would translate to Pentagon procurement or international diplomacy. On Wednesday, Trump met the CEOs of Lockheed and Boeing at his resort in Palm Beach, Florida. Boeing CEO Dennis Muilenburg told reporters there that he had guaranteed costs would not get out of control for a replacement to Air Force One, the presidential plane, another project Trump calls too expensive. Lockheed Chief Executive Marillyn Hewson did not speak to reporters but said in a statement that the meeting was &#8220;productive.&#8221; Trump told reporters he wanted to cut the F-35 program&#8217;s costs. If he scrapped the F-35, such a move by a new administration would have some precedent. Then-President Jimmy Carter canceled the B-1 bomber program in June 1977, although it was resurrected by his White House successor, Ronald Reagan. Trump&#8217;s jockeying for leverage via his Twitter account is likely to be a hurdle for all U.S. defense contractors in the next administration, Roman Schweizer, aerospace and defense analyst at financial services firm Cowen &amp; Co, wrote in a note to clients on Thursday. &#8220;We have no idea how this plays out but believe &#8216;Twitter risk&#8217; for defense companies could be a significant issue over the next four years,&#8221; Schweizer wrote. &#8220;This is Lockheed Martin&#8217;s time in the barrel.&#8221;","rendered":"\u003Cp class=\"p1\"\u003E\u003Cspan C-suite.","parent":0,"count":20253,"filter":"raw"}]}},{"id":1888442,"date":"2016-12-22T14:53:49","date_gmt":"2016-12-22T19:53:49","guid":{"rendered":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F?p=1888442"},"paid":false,"modified":"2016-12-22T17:56:17","modified_gmt":"2016-12-22T22:56:17","slug":"female-fortune-500-ceos-2017","type":"post","subtype":"article","link":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2016\u002F12\u002F22\u002Ffemale-fortune-500-ceos-2017\u002F","shortlink":"http:\u002F\u002Ffor.tn\u002F2hTN90X","dunce":"8432334743","title":{"rendered":"Female Fortune 500 CEOs Are Poised to Break This Record in 2017"},"content":{"plain":"Next year is already looking better than this one, at least when it comes to women in leadership. By the end of the first quarter of 2017, Fortune has learned there will be 27 women leading Fortune 500 companies. While that is an undeniably paltry number, it&#8217;s better than the number of female CEOs in 2016\u2014or ever. The previous record for most female CEOs on the list was set in 2014, when 24 women made the list. This number stayed unchanged the following two years (as of December 2016), meaning that the percentage of women at the top of the Fortune 500 has been holding steady at 4.8%. While we will see a few female chiefs stepping down next year, these losses will be offset by a number of powerful businesswomen stepping up to take their places. For the first time ever, more than 5% of CEOs on the list will be women. Subscribe to the Broadsheet, Fortune\u2019s daily newsletter on the world\u2019s most powerful women. NEWCOMERS 1. Debra Crew will take over as chief of Reynolds American rai on Jan. 1, becoming the first woman to succeed another woman as CEO of a Fortune 500 company. (Susan Cameron will be retiring on the same date). Crew, No. 47 on Fortune&#8216;s Most Powerful Women list, currently serves as COO and president of R.J. Reynolds, the tobacco company&#8217;s largest subsidiary. 2. Anna Manning will be taking over as CEO of Reinsurance Group of America rga on the first day of next year. Manning has been with the company since 2007 and most recently served as its president. 3. Kathryn Marinello, who was most recently a senior adviser to Ares Capital Management, will take over the helm of Hertz Global Holdings htz on Jan. 3. The appointment pleased activist investor Carl Icahn, the car rental company&#8217;s largest shareholder, who said he has said that he is &#8220;excited about Hertz and its prospects with [Marinello] at the helm.&#8221; See our full list of the Most Powerful Women of 2016 here. 4. Michele Buck, an 11-year veteran of Hershey hsy , has been tapped to serve as the chocolate maker&#8217;s next president and CEO. The 55-year-old currently serves as the company&#8217;s COO and will officially begin to steer the company on March 1. 5. Geisha Williams, currently the president of PG&amp;E Corp.&#8217;s pcg electric business, will become president and CEO of the company on March 1. She is the first woman to be the company&#8217;s top boss. DROPOFFS 1. Susan Cameron is retiring from her post at Reynolds American on Jan. 1 for the second time. Her first tenure at the helm of the company lasted seven years before she passed the baton to her successor in 2011. The 58-year-old&#8217;s first stab at retirement lasted about three years before she was asked to come back. 2. Ursula Burns is retiring from her post at Xerox xrx after nearly eight years as chief. Her stepping down means that Fortune 500 CEOs will have no women of color in their ranks. Burns appeared at No. 25 on on Fortune&#8216;s Most Powerful Women list this year.","rendered":"\u003Cp style=\"text-align:left;\"\u003ENext year is already looking better than this one, at least when it comes to women in leadership.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align:left;\"\u003EBy the end of the first quarter of 2017, \u003Cem\u003EFortune\u003C\u002Fem\u003E has learned there will be 27 women leading \u003Cem\u003EFortune \u003C\u002Fem\u003E500 companies. While that is an undeniably paltry number, it&#8217;s better than the number of female CEOs in 2016\u2014or ever.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align:left;\"\u003EThe previous record for most female CEOs on the list was set in 2014, when 24 women made the list. Third-Party Sellers Had Record-Breaking Sales in 2016"},"content":{"plain":"Amazon.com amzn shipped 50 percent more items this holiday season than last for third-party vendors and doubled the amount for 2016 overall, the retail giant said on Wednesday. The news offers new data points for investors who are hoping Amazon will post a profit for the fourth quarter when it announces results in the coming weeks. Seattle-based Amazon, known for its roller coaster results in years past, has forecast that operating income would range from nothing to $1.25 billion. Amazon, the world&#8217;s largest online retailer, has said the 2016 holiday was its best-ever shopping season. However, high spending on warehouses and video production are expected to drag on profits. More sellers are paying the company to store, pack and ship their goods through the Fulfillment by Amazon service. Amazon more than doubled the items it delivered for other sellers in 2016 from the year prior to exceed two billion, a spokesman said. Active sellers using the fulfillment service rose more than 70 percent in the year, Amazon said on Wednesday. It did not specify the total number of vendors. &nbsp; Third-party sales were &#8220;record-breaking&#8221; in 2016, Peter Faricy, vice president for Amazon Marketplace, said in the statement. Amazon takes a cut of the proceeds. Amazon will likely top its profit-margin guidance for the fourth quarter, Morningstar analyst R.J. Hottovy said in a research note last week. Price competition seemed subdued in December and Amazon avoided delivery bottlenecks it experienced in 2015, he said. Cyber Monday, a shopping spree four days after Thanksgiving, is another indicator. Shoppers ordered more than 28 million items from third-party sellers this year, versus more than 23 million items on Cyber Monday in 2015, Amazon said. Amazon is building its own fleet of planes to handle the rise in orders and supplement shipping that it contracts out to companies like FedEx Corp and United Parcel Service Inc . Data reviewed by Reuters and interviews with airport officials show that Amazon has loaded these aircraft with big but lightweight boxes, helping it dodge fees from cargo carriers increasingly pricing based on volume rather than weight. The company does not disclose the revenue it generates from its Fulfillment by Amazon service. Chief Executive Jeff Bezos has said that close to 50 percent of the units purchased on Amazon come from third-party vendors. Clicks on product advertisements paid for by third-party sellers grew 150 percent, Amazon said.","rendered":"\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Famazoncom-18\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EAmazon.com\u003C\u002Fa\u003E \u003Cspan class=\"tickershortcode quotecard_hook unprocessed neutral\" data-symbol=\"amzn\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"wrapper trend-wrapper\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003Ca class=\"exit_trigger_set\" href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Famazon-com-18\u002F\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"ticker\"\u003Eamzn\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"change percent\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E shipped 50 percent more items this holiday season than last for third-party vendors and doubled the amount for 2016 overall, the retail giant said on Wednesday.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe news offers new data points for investors who are hoping Amazon will post a profit for the fourth quarter when it announces results in the coming weeks. Trudeau Appeals To U.S. Congress Amid Fears Of Trump Protectionism"},"content":{"plain":"Prime Minister Justin Trudeau reached out in a video address to the new U.S. Congress on Tuesday to stress how tightly linked the economies of Canada and the United States are, amid fears of a protectionist Trump administration. U.S. President-elect Donald Trump, who has promised to either renegotiate or scrap the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA), has said overhauling trade policy will be a top priority after he takes office on Jan. 20. Canada sends 75% of its exports to the United States and could suffer from changes to NAFTA, which also includes Mexico. Ford Motor f on Tuesday scrapped a planned Mexican car factory and added 700 jobs in Michigan following criticism by Trump, who turned his attention toward General Motors gm with the threat of a &#8220;big border tax&#8221; over compact cars made in Mexico. In the video address, Trudeau and David MacNaughton, the Canadian ambassador to Washington, stressed the closeness of ties between the neighbors. &#8220;We&#8217;ve built an economic relationship that supports jobs in every Congressional district. We are the largest international customer for goods and services made in the USA,&#8221; said Trudeau, who was filmed in his office in front of the U.S. and Canadian flags. MacNaughton said Canada was ready to work with Congress to make the lives of citizens in both nations better and more prosperous. Christine Constantin, a spokeswoman for the Canadian embassy in Washington, said ambassadors had sent video greetings to the two previous opening sessions of Congress. For more on Canada-U.S. relations, watch Fortune&#8217;s video: Trudeau, who has made ties with the United States a priority, was asked by the embassy to appear in the video, she said. Trudeau spokesman Cameron Ahmad declined to elaborate on the video, saying the prime minister&#8217;s message spoke for itself. In the run-up to the 2016 U.S election, Canadian diplomats fanned out across the country to stress that Canada is the top export destination for 35 U.S. states and that nine million U.S. jobs depend on trade with Canada.","rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EPrime Minister Justin Trudeau reached out in a video address to the new U.S. Congress on Tuesday to stress how tightly linked the economies of Canada and the United States are, amid fears of a protectionist Trump administration.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EU.S. President-elect Donald Trump, who has promised to either renegotiate or scrap the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA), has said overhauling trade policy will be a top priority after he takes office on Jan. 20.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ECanada sends 75% of its exports to the United States and could suffer from changes to NAFTA, which also includes Mexico. A lecturer on branding and marketing at Howard University and a former Mrs. America pageant contestant, Manigault, 42, was one of Trump&#8217;s more visible African-American supporters during his successful election bid. The Youngstown, Ohio, native also worked at the White House during the Clinton administration, in Vice President Al Gore&#8217;s office. For more on Donald Trump, watch this video: Trump won national attention by hosting the first 14 seasons of the NBC TV game show The Apprentice, in which contestants vied to demonstrate their business skills and win a job running one of his companies. Typically, Trump would eliminate one hopeful each week with his trademark phrase, &#8220;You&#8217;re fired.&#8221;","rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EOmarosa Manigault, best-known for repeatedly being fired Taco Has Been Described as \u2018Cat Food\u2019 But Americans Eat 554 Million Each Year"},"content":{"plain":"Fans of fast food chain Jack in the Box jack may or may not be surprised to learn that the company&#8217;s best-selling item is its long-running and much maligned taco. The Wall Street Journal reports that 554 million of the tacos are eaten every year, despite many customers proclaiming they are &#8220;vile&#8221; and &#8220;disgusting.&#8221; The company\u2014better known for its burgers\u2014creates its tacos by putting a tortilla wrapped with beef filling into the fryer, and then topped with hot sauce, lettuce and American cheese. This combination, atypical for tacos, have led to doubts whether the concoction Jack in the Box cooks up even is a taco. Customers have described the fillings as oily and gooey, especially if it&#8217;s not immediately consumed. As one Twitter user puts it, &#8220;they&#8217;re more like a wet envelope of cat food.&#8221; Jack in the Box tacos aren&#39;t tacos. They&#39;re more like a wet envelope of cat food. When you eat them you&#39;re just mailing yourself diarrhea. &mdash; Mike Primavera (@primawesome) October 22, 2016 But many people have taken to social media to express their love, disgust, or a simultaneous gushing of love and disgust for the Jack in the Box taco, reports Business Insider. One first-time eater of the taco summed up her experience to the Journal as: &#8220;This is vile and amazing.&#8221; @primawesome I wasn&#39;t knocking Jack in the Box tacos. I&#39;m saying that despite how gross they are, I love them more than my own mother. &mdash; Mike Primavera (@primawesome) October 22, 2016 For more on fast food, watch this video: Despite the complicated feelings Americans have towards its tacos, Jack in the Box is cashing in, according to Business Insider. Same-store sales rose by 2% in the last quarter, beating &#8220;major competitors in the burger category&#8221; as the company put it\u2014tacos surely have a role to play, as the single most popular menu item for the restaurant chain. &nbsp;","rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EFans of fast food chain Jack in the Box \u003Cspan class=\"tickershortcode quotecard_hook unprocessed neutral\" data-symbol=\"jack\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"wrapper trend-wrapper\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003Ca class=\"exit_trigger_set\" href=\"\u002Fcompany\u002Fjack\u002F\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"ticker\"\u003Ejack\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"change percent\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E may or may not be surprised to learn that the company&#8217;s best-selling item is its long-running and much maligned taco.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe \u003Cem\u003EWall Street Journal\u003C\u002Fem\u003E \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.wsj.com\u002Farticles\u002Famericans-eat-554-million-jack-in-the-box-tacos-a-year-and-no-one-knows-why-1483465285\"\u003Ereports\u003C\u002Fa\u003E that 554 million of the tacos are eaten every year, despite many customers proclaiming they are &#8220;vile&#8221; and &#8220;disgusting.&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe company\u2014better known for its burgers\u2014creates its tacos by putting a tortilla wrapped with beef filling into the fryer, and then topped with hot sauce, lettuce and American cheese. BOX","slug":"jack","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":83767,"taxonomy":"company","description":"","parent":0,"count":7,"filter":"raw"}],"fortune:primary_section":[{"term_id":13879,"name":"Retail","slug":"retail","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":46735,"taxonomy":"category","description":"News shop.","parent":0,"count":7410,"filter":"raw"}]}},{"id":1893860,"date":"2017-01-04T03:56:51","date_gmt":"2017-01-04T08:56:51","guid":{"rendered":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F?p=1893860"},"paid":false,"modified":"2017-01-04T03:57:31","modified_gmt":"2017-01-04T08:57:31","slug":"ford-and-toyota-just-became-allies-in-an-unusual-agreement","type":"post","subtype":"article","link":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2017\u002F01\u002F04\u002Fford-and-toyota-just-became-allies-in-an-unusual-agreement\u002F","shortlink":"http:\u002F\u002Ffor.tn\u002F2j7iXTB","dunce":"8432334743","title":{"rendered":"Ford and Toyota Just Became Allies in an Unusual Agreement"},"content":{"plain":"Automakers are scrambling to offer connectivity to their increasingly tech-savvy consumer base and offer seamless integration between cars and smartphones. But not all are keen to connect with systems developed by Apple or Google. Ford Motor f and Toyota Motor tm have formed a consortium to accelerate the deployment of open source software aimed at giving consumers more options in how they connect and control their smartphone apps. The organization is called the SmartDeviceLink (SDL) Consortium, a reference to an open source software version of Ford&#8217;s AppLink. Mazda Motor mzday , PSA Group, Fuji Heavy Industries fujhy , and Suzuki Motor szkmy , are the first automaker members of the consortium. Suppliers Elektrobit ebttf , Harman har , Luxoft lxft , QNX, and Xevo have also joined the nonprofit organization. Get Data Sheet, Fortune\u2019s technology newsletter. The formation of the consortium follows Toyota&#8217;s announcement last January that it planned to use the SDL software in its cars to give drivers command and control of smartphone apps through dashboard buttons, display screens, and voice recognition tech. Toyota plans to commercialize an infotainment system using SDL around 2018. The unusual agreement between the typically competitive companies showed the wariness of some automakers to hand over control to third-party companies\u2014namely Apple aapl and Google googl . Apple CarPlay and Android Auto are two connectivity systems that allow a smartphone to take over a car\u2019s center screen. Once users plug their smartphones into the car\u2019s USB ports, the phones&#8217; maps and navigation, music, and selected apps are integrated onto the central screen. Ford and Toyota argue that an open source code is a better approach, because developers and automakers working together can increase the quality and security of the software. If the industry adopts the software, developers would gain access to millions of vehicles and their drivers worldwide, while participating companies would still be able to retain control over the level of access outside parties have to vehicle data, the companies said. Ford has abandoned Apple&#8217;s and Google&#8217;s offerings, however. The company has taken an all-of-the-above approach to connectivity in the car. It&#8217;s keeping Sync, the in-car communications and entertainment system that lets you use your voice to make a call, listen to music, and select apps with its AppLink technology. At the same time, Ford is also adding Apple CarPlay and Android Auto to new models.","rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EAutomakers are scrambling to offer connectivity to their increasingly tech-savvy consumer base and offer seamless integration between cars and smartphones. offerings, however. The company has taken an all-of-the-above approach to connectivity in the car. It&#8217;s keeping Sync, the in-car communications and entertainment system that lets you use your voice to make a call, listen to music, and select apps with its AppLink technology.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAt the same time, Ford is also adding Apple CarPlay and Android Auto to new models.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Automakers are scrambling to offer connectivity to their increasingly tech-savvy consumer base and offer seamless integration between cars and smartphones. But not all are keen to connect with systems developed by ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fapple-3\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["Apple"]}," or ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Falphabet-36\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["Google"]},"."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Ford Motor ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"f"},"content":[]}," and Toyota Motor ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"tm"},"content":[]}," have formed a consortium to accelerate the deployment of open source software aimed at giving consumers more options in how they connect and control their smartphone apps."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The organization is called the SmartDeviceLink (SDL) Consortium, a reference to an open source software version of Ford's AppLink."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Mazda Motor ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"mzday"},"content":[]},", PSA Group, Fuji Heavy Industries ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"fujhy"},"content":[]},", and Suzuki Motor ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"szkmy"},"content":[]},", are the first automaker members of the consortium. Suppliers Elektrobit ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"ebttf"},"content":[]},", Harman ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"har"},"content":[]},", Luxoft ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"lxft"},"content":[]},", QNX, and Xevo have also joined the nonprofit organization."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":{"style":"text-align:center;"},"content":[{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Fgetdatasheet\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["Get Data Sheet"]},", "]},"Fortune",{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["\u2019s"]},{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":[" technology newsletter."]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The formation of the consortium follows Toyota's announcement last January that it planned to use the SDL software in its cars to give drivers command and control of smartphone apps through dashboard buttons, display screens, and voice recognition tech. Toyota plans to commercialize an infotainment system using SDL around 2018."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The unusual agreement between the typically competitive companies showed the wariness of some automakers to hand over control to third-party companies\u2014namely Apple ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"aapl"},"content":[]}," and Google ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"googl"},"content":[]},". Apple CarPlay and Android Auto are two connectivity systems that allow a smartphone to take over a car\u2019s center screen. Once users plug their smartphones into the car\u2019s USB ports, the phones' maps and navigation, music, and selected apps are integrated onto the central screen."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Ford and Toyota argue that an open source code is a better approach, because developers and automakers working together can increase the quality and security of the software. If the industry adopts the software, developers would gain access to millions of vehicles and their drivers worldwide, while participating companies would still be able to retain control over the level of access outside parties have to vehicle data, the companies said."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":{"style":"text-align:center;"},"content":[]},{"tag":"video","attributes":{"videoid":"4913546721001","controls":"1"},"content":[]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Ford has abandoned Apple's and Google's offerings, however. It's keeping Sync, the in-car communications and entertainment system that lets you use your voice to make a call, listen to music, and select apps with its AppLink technology."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["At the same time, Ford is also adding Apple CarPlay and Android Auto to new models."]}]},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EThe two automakers want the industry to embrace open source \u002Fposts\u002F1893860\u002Fpopular"}],"fortune:listicle":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F1893860\u002Flisticle"}],"fortune:gallery":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F1893860\u002Fgallery"}],"fortune:primary_tag":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F1893860\u002Fprimary_tag"}],"fortune:primary_section":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F1893860\u002Fprimary_section"}],"ng:more:brand":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F1893860\u002Fbrand"}]},"_embedded":{"wp:meta":[{"mt_seo_title":"Toyota, Agreement","protected":0,"og_image":null,"listicle":{"items":{"item":[]},"display":{"ranking":false,"order":"ASC"},"social":{"tweet_text":""}},"bitly_url":"http:\u002F\u002Ffor.tn\u002F2j7iXTB","twitter_text":"Ford and Toyota Just Became Allies in an Unusual Agreement","negative_coverage":false,"permalink":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2017\u002F01\u002F04\u002Fford-and-toyota-just-became-allies-in-an-unusual-agreement\u002F","amp_link":"http:\u002F\u002Famp.timeinc.net\u002Ffortune\u002F2017\u002F01\u002F04\u002Fford-and-toyota-just-became-allies-in-an-unusual-agreement\u002F?source=dam"}],"fortune:featured":[{"size":"article_full","type":"image","visible":true,"image":{"id":1156186,"link":"https:\u002F\u002Ffortunedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2015\u002F06\u002Ffordsync3-1.jpg","alt":"Ford 3"},"video":null,"structured":null}],"fortune:primary_tag":[{"term_id":2449302,"name":"Global 500","slug":"global-500","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":156716,"taxonomy":"person","description":"","parent":0,"count":0,"filter":"raw"}],"fortune:primary_section":[{"term_id":6688,"name":"Autos","slug":"autos","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":46736,"taxonomy":"category","description":"News and analysis of the automobile industry, from the latest cars to the latest executive shakeups at GM, Ford, Chrysler, and other motor vehicle manufacturers.","parent":0,"count":3395,"filter":"raw"}]}},{"id":1893164,"date":"2017-01-03T23:56:26","date_gmt":"2017-01-04T04:56:26","guid":{"rendered":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F?p=1893164"},"paid":false,"modified":"2017-01-04T00:00:08","modified_gmt":"2017-01-04T05:00:08","slug":"ford-cancels-mexico-plant-trump","type":"post","subtype":"article","link":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2017\u002F01\u002F03\u002Fford-cancels-mexico-plant-trump\u002F","shortlink":"http:\u002F\u002Ffor.tn\u002F2j4OtBt","dunce":"8432334743","title":{"rendered":"Ford Cancels a $1.6 Billion Mexico Plant and Adds 700 Jobs in Michigan"},"content":{"plain":"Ford Motor Co f on Tuesday scrapped a planned Mexican car factory and added 700 jobs in Michigan following criticism by Donald Trump, as the U.S. president-elect turned his attention toward rival General Motors Co with the threat of a &#8220;big border tax&#8221; over compact cars made in Mexico. Ford CEO Mark Fields called the move &#8220;a vote of confidence&#8221; in Trump, but primarily a response to a decline in North American demand for small cars like those that would have been made at the Mexican plant. He said Ford would have made the same decision even if Trump had not been elected. Ford will cancel plans unveiled in April to spend $1.6 billion to build the new plant in San Luis Potosi, Mexico, a project Trump urged the automaker to abandon and called an &#8220;absolute disgrace&#8221; during the election campaign. The No. 2 U.S. automaker also said it would invest $700 million to expand the Flat Rock, Michigan factory and would make new electric, hybrid and autonomous vehicles there. Trump&#8217;s efforts to browbeat the U.S. car industry show he may go further than other modern presidents to try to influence corporate decisions, especially those related to trade and investment. In a Twitter post hours before Ford&#8217;s announcement, Trump wrote, &#8220;General Motors is sending Mexican made model of Chevy Cruze to U.S. car dealers-tax free across border. Make in U.S.A. or pay big border tax!&#8221; GM, the largest U.S. automaker, said making some of the Cruze cars in the plant in Coahuila, Mexico was part of its strategy to serve global customers, not sell those vehicles in the United States. Trump&#8217;s GM tweet was his latest broadside aimed at an American company over jobs, imports and costs even before he takes office on Jan. 20. Mexico&#8217;s government said it regrets Ford&#8217;s decision and has ensured that the company will reimburse San Luis Potosi state for any costs associated with the investment. &#8220;Obviously, this isn&#8217;t a good decision for us,&#8221; said Mexico&#8217;s economy minister, Ildefonso Guajardo. Ford said it still will shift production from Michigan of its Focus compact car to an existing plant in Hermosillo, Mexico. Fields said he expects Michigan to give incentives for Ford&#8217;s investment in Flat Rock. Ford spokeswoman Jennifer Flake said the automaker will save $500 million by not opening the new plant in the near term, but will have some undisclosed costs to retool the other Mexican plant to build the Focus. Ford shares closed up about 3.8 percent. GM shares rose about 0.9 percent. TRUMP NOTIFIED Top Ford executives personally notified Trump and Vice President-elect Mike Pence of their decision. Fields praised tax and regulatory proposals advocated by Trump and his fellow Republicans who control Congress. &#8220;Our view is that we see a more positive U.S. manufacturing business environment under President-elect Trump and the pro-growth policies and proposals that he&#8217;s talking about, so this is a vote of confidence for President-elect Trump and some of the policies that they may be pursuing,&#8221; Fields said. Union workers gathered at the Flat Rock factory cheered Fields&#8217; announcement. Hiring of the 700 new workers there will probably start in 2018 with the majority of it in 2020, Fields said. Trump said during the presidential campaign that if elected he would not allow Ford to open the new plant in Mexico and would slap hefty tariffs on imported Ford vehicles. Trump also accused Mexico of sending criminals and rapists into the United States and vowed to build a border wall to combat illegal immigration. Since winning the Nov. 8 election, Trump has targeted a wide range of American companies also including United Technologies Inc, Boeing Co and Lockheed Martin Corp. Trump also has touted decisions by companies to keep some production in the United States, including United&#8217;s Carrier unit in Indiana. Trump previously vowed to hit companies that shift production from America to other countries with a 35 percent tax on their exports into the United States. He also has denounced the North American Free Trade Agreement between the United States, Mexico and Canada. Fields said there were no negotiations between Ford and the incoming president over canceling the Mexico plant or investing in Michigan. Ford will build a battery electric SUV with a 300-mile (482-km) driving range at the Michigan plant by 2020, and will launch production there by 2021 of a fully autonomous vehicle without a steering wheel or a brake pedal for use in ride services fleets. Ford also plans new hybrid versions of its F-150 pickup truck, Mustang and police vehicles by 2020. GM said it sold about 190,000 Cruze cars in the United States in 2016. All of the sedan versions sold in the United States, about 185,500, were built at its Lordstown, Ohio plant. About 4,500 hatchback Cruze versions were assembled in Mexico and sold in the United States. This story has been updated. &nbsp;","rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EFord Motor Co \u003Cspan class=\"tickershortcode quotecard_hook unprocessed neutral\" data-symbol=\"f\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"wrapper trend-wrapper\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003Ca class=\"exit_trigger_set\" href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fford-motor-9\u002F\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"ticker\"\u003Ef\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"change percent\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E on Tuesday scrapped a planned Mexican car factory and added 700 jobs in Michigan following criticism by Donald Trump, as the U.S. president-elect turned his attention toward rival \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fgeneral-motors-8\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EGeneral Motors\u003C\u002Fa\u003E Co with the threat of a &#8220;big border tax&#8221; over compact cars made in Mexico.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EFord CEO Mark Fields called the move &#8220;a vote of confidence&#8221; in Trump, but primarily a response to a decline in North American demand for small cars like those that would have been made at the Mexican plant. Fields said he expects Michigan to give incentives for Ford&#8217;s investment in Flat Rock.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EFord spokeswoman Jennifer Flake said the automaker will save $500 million by not opening the new plant in the near term, but will have some undisclosed costs to retool the other Mexican plant to build the Focus.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EFord shares closed up about 3.8 percent. GM shares rose about 0.9 percent.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ETRUMP NOTIFIED\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ETop Ford executives personally notified Trump and Vice President-elect Mike Pence of their decision. Hiring of the 700 new workers there will probably start in 2018 with the majority of it in 2020, Fields said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ETrump said during the presidential campaign that if elected he would not allow Ford to open the new plant in Mexico and would slap hefty tariffs on imported Ford vehicles.
