Score"},"video":null,"structured":null}],"fortune:primary_tag":[{"term_id":446239758,"name":"credit reports","slug":"credit-reports","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":169514,"taxonomy":"post_tag","description":"","parent":0,"count":2,"filter":"raw"}],"fortune:primary_section":[{"term_id":4269,"name":"Finance","slug":"finance","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":46730,"taxonomy":"category","description":"News and analysis on the business of finance, including hedge funds, markets, mergers and acquisitions, private equity, venture capital, and Wall Street.","parent":0,"count":18937,"filter":"raw"}]}},{"id":1893164,"date":"2017-01-03T23:56:26","date_gmt":"2017-01-04T04:56:26","guid":{"rendered":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F?p=1893164"},"paid":false,"modified":"2017-01-04T00:00:08","modified_gmt":"2017-01-04T05:00:08","slug":"ford-cancels-mexico-plant-trump","type":"post","subtype":"article","link":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2017\u002F01\u002F03\u002Fford-cancels-mexico-plant-trump\u002F","shortlink":"http:\u002F\u002Ffor.tn\u002F2j4OtBt","dunce":"8432334743","title":{"rendered":"Ford Cancels a $1.6 Billion Mexico Plant and Adds 700 Jobs in Michigan"},"content":{"plain":"Ford Motor Co f on Tuesday scrapped a planned Mexican car factory and added 700 jobs in Michigan following criticism by Donald Trump, as the U.S. president-elect turned his attention toward rival General Motors Co with the threat of a &#8220;big border tax&#8221; over compact cars made in Mexico. Ford CEO Mark Fields called the move &#8220;a vote of confidence&#8221; in Trump, but primarily a response to a decline in North American demand for small cars like those that would have been made at the Mexican plant. He said Ford would have made the same decision even if Trump had not been elected. Ford will cancel plans unveiled in April to spend $1.6 billion to build the new plant in San Luis Potosi, Mexico, a project Trump urged the automaker to abandon and called an &#8220;absolute disgrace&#8221; during the election campaign. The No. 2 U.S. automaker also said it would invest $700 million to expand the Flat Rock, Michigan factory and would make new electric, hybrid and autonomous vehicles there. Trump&#8217;s efforts to browbeat the U.S. car industry show he may go further than other modern presidents to try to influence corporate decisions, especially those related to trade and investment. In a Twitter post hours before Ford&#8217;s announcement, Trump wrote, &#8220;General Motors is sending Mexican made model of Chevy Cruze to U.S. car dealers-tax free across border. Make in U.S.A. or pay big border tax!&#8221; GM, the largest U.S. automaker, said making some of the Cruze cars in the plant in Coahuila, Mexico was part of its strategy to serve global customers, not sell those vehicles in the United States. Trump&#8217;s GM tweet was his latest broadside aimed at an American company over jobs, imports and costs even before he takes office on Jan. 20. Mexico&#8217;s government said it regrets Ford&#8217;s decision and has ensured that the company will reimburse San Luis Potosi state for any costs associated with the investment. &#8220;Obviously, this isn&#8217;t a good decision for us,&#8221; said Mexico&#8217;s economy minister, Ildefonso Guajardo. Ford said it still will shift production from Michigan of its Focus compact car to an existing plant in Hermosillo, Mexico. Fields said he expects Michigan to give incentives for Ford&#8217;s investment in Flat Rock. Ford spokeswoman Jennifer Flake said the automaker will save $500 million by not opening the new plant in the near term, but will have some undisclosed costs to retool the other Mexican plant to build the Focus. Ford shares closed up about 3.8 percent. GM shares rose about 0.9 percent. TRUMP NOTIFIED Top Ford executives personally notified Trump and Vice President-elect Mike Pence of their decision. Fields praised tax and regulatory proposals advocated by Trump and his fellow Republicans who control Congress. &#8220;Our view is that we see a more positive U.S. manufacturing business environment under President-elect Trump and the pro-growth policies and proposals that he&#8217;s talking about, so this is a vote of confidence for President-elect Trump and some of the policies that they may be pursuing,&#8221; Fields said. Union workers gathered at the Flat Rock factory cheered Fields&#8217; announcement. Hiring of the 700 new workers there will probably start in 2018 with the majority of it in 2020, Fields said. Trump said during the presidential campaign that if elected he would not allow Ford to open the new plant in Mexico and would slap hefty tariffs on imported Ford vehicles. Trump also accused Mexico of sending criminals and rapists into the United States and vowed to build a border wall to combat illegal immigration. Since winning the Nov. 8 election, Trump has targeted a wide range of American companies also including United Technologies Inc, Boeing Co and Lockheed Martin Corp. Trump also has touted decisions by companies to keep some production in the United States, including United&#8217;s Carrier unit in Indiana. Trump previously vowed to hit companies that shift production from America to other countries with a 35 percent tax on their exports into the United States. He also has denounced the North American Free Trade Agreement between the United States, Mexico and Canada. Fields said there were no negotiations between Ford and the incoming president over canceling the Mexico plant or investing in Michigan. Ford will build a battery electric SUV with a 300-mile (482-km) driving range at the Michigan plant by 2020, and will launch production there by 2021 of a fully autonomous vehicle without a steering wheel or a brake pedal for use in ride services fleets. Ford also plans new hybrid versions of its F-150 pickup truck, Mustang and police vehicles by 2020. GM said it sold about 190,000 Cruze cars in the United States in 2016. All of the sedan versions sold in the United States, about 185,500, were built at its Lordstown, Ohio plant. About 4,500 hatchback Cruze versions were assembled in Mexico and sold in the United States. This story has been updated. &nbsp;","rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EFord Motor Co \u003Cspan class=\"tickershortcode quotecard_hook unprocessed neutral\" data-symbol=\"f\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"wrapper trend-wrapper\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003Ca class=\"exit_trigger_set\" href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fford-motor-9\u002F\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"ticker\"\u003Ef\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"change percent\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E on Tuesday scrapped a planned Mexican car factory and added 700 jobs in Michigan following criticism by Donald Trump, as the U.S. president-elect turned his attention toward rival \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fgeneral-motors-8\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EGeneral Motors\u003C\u002Fa\u003E Co with the threat of a &#8220;big border tax&#8221; over compact cars made in Mexico.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EFord CEO Mark Fields called the move &#8220;a vote of confidence&#8221; in Trump, but primarily a response to a decline in North American demand for small cars like those that would have been made at the Mexican plant. and Boeing Win 4 More NASA Manned Missions to Space"},"content":{"plain":"NASA has awarded four additional contracts to SpaceX and Boeing for manned flights to and from the International Space Station. On Tuesday, the administration announced that Boeing, headed by Dennis Muilenburg, and SpaceX, run by Elon Musk, had been awarded the additional missions\u2014bringing each of their total number of NASA contracts to send people into space to six. &#8220;Awarding these missions now will provide greater stability for the future space station crew rotation schedule, as well as reduce schedule and financial uncertainty for our providers,&#8221; Phil McAlister, director, NASA\u2019s Commercial Spaceflight Development Division said in a statement. \u201cThe ability to turn on missions as needed to meet the needs of the space station program is an important aspect of the Commercial Crew Program.\u201d The Commercial Crew Program was created by NASA as a way to put astronauts into space using the private sector. But both Boeing and SpaceX will first have to pass their spacecrafts through NASA certification. &nbsp; Boeing is scheduled to test an uncrewed version of its proposed flight, the CST-100 Starliner, in June 2018, followed by its crewed flight test in August 2018. SpaceX is expected to demonstrate an uncrewed version of its Crew Dragon flight to the space station in November 2017, followed by a crewed test in May 2018.","rendered":"\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Fvideo\u002F2017\u002F01\u002F03\u002Fspacex-will-launch-in-january\u002F\"\u003ENASA has awarded four additional contracts\u003C\u002Fa\u003E to SpaceX and \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fboeing-24\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EBoeing\u003C\u002Fa\u003E for manned flights to and from the International Space Station.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EOn Tuesday, the administration announced that Boeing, headed by Dennis Muilenburg, and SpaceX, run by Elon Musk, had been awarded the additional missions\u2014\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Fvideo\u002F2014\u002F09\u002F17\u002Fnasa-chooses-spacex-boeing\u002F\"\u003Ebringing each of their total number of NASA contracts to send people into space to six\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan class=\"s1\"\u003E&#8220;Awarding these missions now will provide greater stability for the future space station crew rotation schedule, as well as reduce schedule and financial uncertainty for our providers,&#8221; Phil McAlister, director, NASA\u2019s Commercial Spaceflight Development Division \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.nasa.gov\u002Ffeature\u002Fmission-awards-secure-commercial-crew-transportation-for-coming-years\"\u003Esaid in a statement\u003C\u002Fa\u003E. \u201cThe ability to turn on missions as needed to meet the needs of the space station program is an important aspect of the Commercial Crew Program.\u201d\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe Commercial Crew Program was created by NASA as a way to put astronauts into space using the private sector. vehicles"},"video":null,"structured":null}],"fortune:primary_tag":[{"term_id":371748,"name":"SpaceX","slug":"spacex","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":58087,"taxonomy":"post_tag","description":"","parent":0,"count":204,"filter":"raw"}],"fortune:primary_section":[{"term_id":318,"name":"Tech","slug":"tech","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":46728,"taxonomy":"category","description":"News, analysis, and insight into technology and business, including Silicon Valley giants like Apple, Google, Facebook, and our annual Brainstorm Tech conference.","parent":0,"count":36555,"filter":"raw"}]}},{"id":1893984,"date":"2017-01-04T07:17:13","date_gmt":"2017-01-04T12:17:13","guid":{"rendered":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F?p=1893984"},"paid":false,"modified":"2017-01-04T07:17:13","modified_gmt":"2017-01-04T12:17:13","slug":"amazon-marketplace-sales","type":"post","subtype":"article","link":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2017\u002F01\u002F04\u002Famazon-marketplace-sales\u002F","shortlink":"http:\u002F\u002Ffor.tn\u002F2hQEdfO","dunce":"8432334743","title":{"rendered":"Amazon\u2019s Third-Party Sellers Had Record-Breaking Sales in 2016"},"content":{"plain":"Amazon.com amzn shipped 50 percent more items this holiday season than last for third-party vendors and doubled the amount for 2016 overall, the retail giant said on Wednesday. The news offers new data points for investors who are hoping Amazon will post a profit for the fourth quarter when it announces results in the coming weeks. Seattle-based Amazon, known for its roller coaster results in years past, has forecast that operating income would range from nothing to $1.25 billion. Amazon, the world&#8217;s largest online retailer, has said the 2016 holiday was its best-ever shopping season. However, high spending on warehouses and video production are expected to drag on profits. More sellers are paying the company to store, pack and ship their goods through the Fulfillment by Amazon service. Amazon more than doubled the items it delivered for other sellers in 2016 from the year prior to exceed two billion, a spokesman said. Active sellers using the fulfillment service rose more than 70 percent in the year, Amazon said on Wednesday. It did not specify the total number of vendors. &nbsp; Third-party sales were &#8220;record-breaking&#8221; in 2016, Peter Faricy, vice president for Amazon Marketplace, said in the statement. Amazon takes a cut of the proceeds. Amazon will likely top its profit-margin guidance for the fourth quarter, Morningstar analyst R.J. Hottovy said in a research note last week. Price competition seemed subdued in December and Amazon avoided delivery bottlenecks it experienced in 2015, he said. Cyber Monday, a shopping spree four days after Thanksgiving, is another indicator. Shoppers ordered more than 28 million items from third-party sellers this year, versus more than 23 million items on Cyber Monday in 2015, Amazon said. Amazon is building its own fleet of planes to handle the rise in orders and supplement shipping that it contracts out to companies like FedEx Corp and United Parcel Service Inc . Data reviewed by Reuters and interviews with airport officials show that Amazon has loaded these aircraft with big but lightweight boxes, helping it dodge fees from cargo carriers increasingly pricing based on volume rather than weight. The company does not disclose the revenue it generates from its Fulfillment by Amazon service. Chief Executive Jeff Bezos has said that close to 50 percent of the units purchased on Amazon come from third-party vendors. Clicks on product advertisements paid for by third-party sellers grew 150 percent, Amazon said.","rendered":"\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Famazoncom-18\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EAmazon.com\u003C\u002Fa\u003E \u003Cspan class=\"tickershortcode quotecard_hook unprocessed neutral\" data-symbol=\"amzn\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"wrapper trend-wrapper\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003Ca class=\"exit_trigger_set\" href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Famazon-com-18\u002F\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"ticker\"\u003Eamzn\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"change percent\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E shipped 50 percent more items this holiday season than last for third-party vendors and doubled the amount for 2016 overall, the retail giant said on Wednesday.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe news offers new data points for investors who are hoping Amazon will post a profit for the fourth quarter when it announces results in the coming weeks. Seattle-based Amazon, known for its roller coaster results in years past, has forecast that operating income would range from nothing to $1.25 billion.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAmazon, the world&#8217;s largest online retailer, has said the 2016 holiday was its best-ever shopping season. However, high spending on warehouses and video production are expected to drag on profits.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EMore sellers are paying the company to store, pack and ship their goods through the Fulfillment by Amazon service. Amazon more than doubled the items it delivered for other sellers in 2016 from the year prior to exceed two billion, a spokesman said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EActive sellers using the fulfillment service rose more than 70 percent in the year, Amazon said on Wednesday. It did not specify the total number of vendors.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"video-wrapper\"  data-ratio=\"0.56363636363636\" data-pos=\"2\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003Cobject Hottovy said in a research note last week. Price competition seemed subdued in December and Amazon avoided delivery bottlenecks it experienced in 2015, he said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ECyber Monday, a shopping spree four days after Thanksgiving, is another indicator. Shoppers ordered more than 28 million items from third-party sellers this year, versus more than 23 million items on Cyber Monday in 2015, Amazon said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAmazon is building its own fleet of planes to handle the rise in orders and supplement shipping that it contracts out to companies like \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Ffedex-58\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EFedEx\u003C\u002Fa\u003E Corp and \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fups-48\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EUnited Parcel Service\u003C\u002Fa\u003E Inc . Data reviewed by Reuters and interviews with airport officials show that Amazon has loaded these aircraft with big but lightweight boxes, helping it dodge fees from cargo carriers increasingly pricing based on volume rather than weight.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe company does not disclose the revenue it generates from its Fulfillment by Amazon service. Chief Executive Jeff Bezos has said that close to 50 percent of the units purchased on Amazon come from third-party vendors.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EClicks on product advertisements paid for by third-party sellers grew 150 percent, Amazon said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Famazoncom-18\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["Amazon.com"]}," ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"amzn"},"content":[]}," shipped 50 percent more items this holiday season than last for third-party vendors and doubled the amount for 2016 overall, the retail giant said on Wednesday."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The news offers new data points for investors who are hoping Amazon will post a profit for the fourth quarter when it announces results in the coming weeks. conference.","parent":0,"count":36555,"filter":"raw"}]}},{"id":1893860,"date":"2017-01-04T03:56:51","date_gmt":"2017-01-04T08:56:51","guid":{"rendered":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F?p=1893860"},"paid":false,"modified":"2017-01-04T03:57:31","modified_gmt":"2017-01-04T08:57:31","slug":"ford-and-toyota-just-became-allies-in-an-unusual-agreement","type":"post","subtype":"article","link":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2017\u002F01\u002F04\u002Fford-and-toyota-just-became-allies-in-an-unusual-agreement\u002F","shortlink":"http:\u002F\u002Ffor.tn\u002F2j7iXTB","dunce":"8432334743","title":{"rendered":"Ford and Toyota Just Became Allies in an Unusual Agreement"},"content":{"plain":"Automakers are scrambling to offer connectivity to their increasingly tech-savvy consumer base and offer seamless integration between cars and smartphones. But not all are keen to connect with systems developed by Apple or Google. Ford Motor f and Toyota Motor tm have formed a consortium to accelerate the deployment of open source software aimed at giving consumers more options in how they connect and control their smartphone apps. The organization is called the SmartDeviceLink (SDL) Consortium, a reference to an open source software version of Ford&#8217;s AppLink. Mazda Motor mzday , PSA Group, Fuji Heavy Industries fujhy , and Suzuki Motor szkmy , are the first automaker members of the consortium. Suppliers Elektrobit ebttf , Harman har , Luxoft lxft , QNX, and Xevo have also joined the nonprofit organization. Get Data Sheet, Fortune\u2019s technology newsletter. The formation of the consortium follows Toyota&#8217;s announcement last January that it planned to use the SDL software in its cars to give drivers command and control of smartphone apps through dashboard buttons, display screens, and voice recognition tech. Toyota plans to commercialize an infotainment system using SDL around 2018. The unusual agreement between the typically competitive companies showed the wariness of some automakers to hand over control to third-party companies\u2014namely Apple aapl and Google googl . Apple CarPlay and Android Auto are two connectivity systems that allow a smartphone to take over a car\u2019s center screen. Once users plug their smartphones into the car\u2019s USB ports, the phones&#8217; maps and navigation, music, and selected apps are integrated onto the central screen. Ford and Toyota argue that an open source code is a better approach, because developers and automakers working together can increase the quality and security of the software. If the industry adopts the software, developers would gain access to millions of vehicles and their drivers worldwide, while participating companies would still be able to retain control over the level of access outside parties have to vehicle data, the companies said. Ford has abandoned Apple&#8217;s and Google&#8217;s offerings, however. The company has taken an all-of-the-above approach to connectivity in the car. It&#8217;s keeping Sync, the in-car communications and entertainment system that lets you use your voice to make a call, listen to music, and select apps with its AppLink technology. At the same time, Ford is also adding Apple CarPlay and Android Auto to new models.","rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EAutomakers are scrambling to offer connectivity to their increasingly tech-savvy consumer base and offer seamless integration between cars and smartphones. of the consortium follows Toyota&#8217;s announcement last January that it planned to use the SDL software in its cars to give drivers command and control of smartphone apps through dashboard buttons, display screens, and voice recognition tech. Toyota plans to commercialize an infotainment system using SDL around 2018.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe unusual agreement between the typically competitive companies showed the wariness of some automakers to hand over control to third-party companies\u2014namely Apple \u003Cspan class=\"tickershortcode quotecard_hook unprocessed neutral\" data-symbol=\"aapl\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"wrapper trend-wrapper\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003Ca class=\"exit_trigger_set\" href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fapple-3\u002F\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"ticker\"\u003Eaapl\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"change percent\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E and Google \u003Cspan class=\"tickershortcode quotecard_hook unprocessed neutral\" data-symbol=\"googl\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"wrapper trend-wrapper\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003Ca class=\"exit_trigger_set\" href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Falphabet-36\u002F\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"ticker\"\u003Egoogl\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"change percent\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E. Apple CarPlay and Android Auto are two connectivity systems that allow a smartphone to take over a car\u2019s center screen. Once users plug their smartphones into the car\u2019s USB ports, the phones&#8217; maps and navigation, music, and selected apps are integrated onto the central screen.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EFord and Toyota argue that an open source code is a better approach, because developers and automakers working together can increase the quality and security of the software. If the industry adopts the software, developers would gain access to millions of vehicles and their drivers worldwide, while participating companies would still be able to retain control over the level of access outside parties have to vehicle data, the companies said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align:center;\"\u003E\u003Cdiv class=\"video-wrapper\" offerings, however. The company has taken an all-of-the-above approach to connectivity in the car. It&#8217;s keeping Sync, the in-car communications and entertainment system that lets you use your voice to make a call, listen to music, and select apps with its AppLink technology.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAt the same time, Ford is also adding Apple CarPlay and Android Auto to new models.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Automakers are scrambling to offer connectivity to their increasingly tech-savvy consumer base and offer seamless integration between cars and smartphones. Investors Are Betting On Samsung\u2019s Best Quarterly Profit in 3 Years"},"content":{"plain":"Samsung Electronics ssnlf is likely to forecast its best quarterly profit in nearly three years on Friday, analysts said, with robust memory chip sales easing the pain of the costly failure of a flagship smartphone. The South Korean firm discontinued sales of the Galaxy Note 7 phones after some of the devices caught fire, warning of a $2.1 billion hit to its profit in the fourth quarter of 2016 due to expenses tied to an ongoing global recall and lost sales. But investors are betting a surge in sales of memory chips and organic light-emitting diode screens for smartphones will translate to strong earnings growth for the October-December period and through 2017. Samsung&#8217;s operating profit likely rose for a second straight quarter to 8.4 trillion won ($7 billion) over October-December, according to a Thomson Reuters StarMine SmartEstimate derived from a survey of 15 analysts, up 37% from a year ago and the highest since the first quarter of 2014. &#8220;We look for the memory business to post a big earnings improvement and contribute 50% of its (Samsung&#8217;s) total operating profit for Q416,&#8221; Daiwa said in a report. Memory chip prices have spiked recently on demand for more firepower on mobile devices. But it is the sales of the higher-end 3D NAND chips which have rallied significantly, helping Samsung rake in profits given it is ahead of its rivals such as Toshiba tosbf and SK Hynix in the mass production of these chips, analysts said. For more on Samsung, watch Fortune&#8217;s video: Samsung&#8217;s semiconductor profit likely surged to a record 4.5 trillion won for the fourth quarter and 13.1 trillion won for 2016, Eugene Investment said in a report, adding chip earnings will grow further this year on firm demand. HDC Asset Management&#8217;s fund manager Park Jung-hoon agreed that the components business outlook appeared &#8220;pretty solid.&#8221; &#8220;We&#8217;ll have to see how the mobile business does &#8230; but I think Samsung&#8217;s operating profit should be able to come in somewhere around mid-30 trillion won range (this year).&#8221; For the recently ended quarter, Samsung&#8217;s mobile earnings likely rebounded from the dismal third quarter on healthy sales of the Galaxy S7 and S7 edge smartphones, analysts said. Hyundai Securities expects Samsung&#8217;s mobile division&#8217;s operating profit at 2.2 trillion won, in line with a year earlier and up sharply from 99 billion won in July-September. The company&#8217;s shares hit a record 1.831 million won on Tuesday this week ahead of the earnings forecast on Friday. They surged 43% in 2016\u2014the most since 2012\u2014suggesting investors did not expect a serious business impact from Samsung&#8217;s name being dragged into a growing political scandal in the solid.&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;We&#8217;ll have to see how the mobile business does &#8230; but I think Samsung&#8217;s operating profit should be able to come in somewhere around mid-30 trillion won range (this year).&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EFor the recently ended quarter, Samsung&#8217;s mobile earnings likely rebounded from the dismal third quarter on healthy sales of the Galaxy S7 and S7 edge smartphones, analysts said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EHyundai Securities expects Samsung&#8217;s mobile division&#8217;s operating profit at 2.2 trillion won, in line with a year earlier and up sharply from 99 billion won in July-September.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe company&#8217;s shares hit a record 1.831 million won on Tuesday quarterly profit in nearly three years  on Friday , analysts said, with robust memory chip sales easing the pain of the costly failure of a flagship smartphone."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The South Korean firm discontinued sales of the Galaxy Note 7 phones after some of the devices caught fire, warning of a $2.1 billion hit to its profit in the fourth quarter of 2016 due to expenses tied to an ongoing global recall and lost sales."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["But investors are betting a surge in sales of memory chips and organic light-emitting diode screens for smartphones will translate to strong earnings growth for the October-December period and through 2017."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Samsung's operating profit likely rose for a second straight quarter to 8.4 trillion won ($7 billion) over October-December, according to a Thomson Reuters StarMine SmartEstimate derived from a survey of 15 analysts, up 37% from a year ago and the highest since the first quarter of 2014."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["\"We look for the memory business to post a big earnings improvement and contribute 50% of its (Samsung's) total operating profit for Q416,\" Daiwa said in a report."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Memory chip prices have spiked recently on demand for more firepower on mobile devices. But it is the sales of the higher-end 3D NAND chips which have rallied significantly, helping Samsung rake in profits given it is ahead of its rivals such as Toshiba ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"tosbf"},"content":[]}," and SK Hynix in the mass production of these chips, analysts Slowing global demand for smartphones as well as memory chips dealt a blow to Samsung Electronics as it reported a 40 percent on-year drop in fourth-quarter net profit.  AFP PHOTO \u002F JUNG YEON-JE \u002F AFP \u002F JUNG YEON-JE        (Photo credit should read JUNG YEON-JE\u002FAFP\u002FGetty Images)","title":"SKOREA-ECONOMY-SAMSUNG-EARNINGS"},"video":null,"structured":null}],"fortune:primary_tag":[{"term_id":2449302,"name":"Global 500","slug":"global-500","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":156716,"taxonomy":"person","description":"","parent":0,"count":0,"filter":"raw"}],"fortune:primary_section":[{"term_id":4269,"name":"Finance","slug":"finance","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":46730,"taxonomy":"category","description":"News and analysis on the business of finance, including hedge funds, markets, mergers and acquisitions, private equity, venture capital, and Wall Street.","parent":0,"count":18937,"filter":"raw"}]}},{"id":1893807,"date":"2017-01-03T23:45:54","date_gmt":"2017-01-04T04:45:54","guid":{"rendered":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F?p=1893807"},"paid":false,"modified":"2017-01-04T02:12:58","modified_gmt":"2017-01-04T07:12:58","slug":"faraday-future-ff91-ces","type":"post","subtype":"article","link":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2017\u002F01\u002F03\u002Ffaraday-future-ff91-ces\u002F","shortlink":"http:\u002F\u002Ffor.tn\u002F2j2keXN","dunce":"8432334743","title":{"rendered":"Pushing Back on Critics, Faraday Future Unveils Its \u2018New Species\u2019 of Electric Car"},"content":{"plain":"Faraday Future lifted the veil Tuesday on the FF91, an Internet-connected autonomous electric vehicle it describes as the birth of a new breed. The lingering question is whether it can make and deliver this vehicle to the marketplace. For $5,000, consumers can earn a priority place in the reservation line for this &#8220;new species,&#8221; an all-electric vehicle that will get an estimated 378 miles on a single charge and is expected to be delivered in 2018. Those who pony up the refundable deposit will be eligible to upgrade their reservation this spring to the FF 91 Alliance Edition, 300 personalized models that will have an edition-exclusive, paint color. Reserving a standard non-priority spot is free. The event itself was filled with much of the pomp and circumstance that garnered the startup so much criticism last year when it showed off its concept vehicle at an event ahead of CES, the annual consumer electronics show in Las Vegas. Faraday Future returned to CES this year, and found some redemption. The startup showed a vehicle that could actually drive\u2014including a live pseudo-drag race demo onstage\u2014and park itself without a human at the wheel. There were also a lot of promises. The FF91 was presented as a highly customized vehicle that will recognize passengers as they approach. The 1,050 horsepower vehicle is also equipped with two Internet hotspots to ensure passengers have a constant connection to digital content, contains the &#8220;greatest battery pack density,&#8221; and is the fastest on the road\u2014per the company&#8217;s track tests. It&#8217;s a lot; and won&#8217;t be verified until the vehicle hits the marketplace, if it ever does. &#8220;We&#8217;re not stopping with automotive,&#8221; said Nick Sampson, Faraday Future&#8217;s senior vice president of R&amp;D and engineering. &#8220;We don&#8217;t consider ourselves a car company, we&#8217;re a technology company reformatting the future of mobility.&#8221; There were some missteps as well. The company&#8217;s primary backer, LeEco founder Jia Yueting, came onstage to demonstrate its autonomous driving, and the FF91 couldn&#8217;t be convinced to move. Later, the car successfully crept forward to center stage on its own. Get Data Sheet, Fortune\u2019s technology newsletter. Faraday Future describes the FF91 as a production car, which customers can now reserve via their website. Faraday Future isn&#8217;t expected to begin deliveries until 2018, which could mean anywhere between 12 and 23 months from now. Photo by Kirsten Korosec The reveal follows weeks of teasers and a number of troubling developments, including the departure of several key executives, questions of Yueting&#8217;s access to capital, and the halt of construction on its factory in North Las Vegas. None of these problems were mentioned, of course. In one segment of the evening, a video montage of earthmovers clearing dirt at the site of the new factory was shown. Sampson then declared that Phase 1, the grading portion that began in April, was complete and that Phase 2 would begin soon. Despite its troubles, Sampson closed the event with a promise to remain persistent and quiet the company&#8217;s critics. &#8220;Without a shadow of a doubt, despite the naysayers, the skeptics, we will persist,&#8221; Sampson said. &#8220;We will carry on to make the impossible, possible.&#8221; This article was updated at 1 a.m ET","rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EFaraday Future lifted the veil Tuesday on the FF91, an Internet-connected autonomous electric vehicle it describes as the birth of a new breed. Vegas.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ENone of these problems were mentioned, of course. In one segment of the evening, a video montage of earthmovers clearing dirt at the site of the new factory was shown. Sampson then declared that Phase 1, the grading portion that began in April, was complete and that Phase 2 would begin soon.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EDespite its troubles, Sampson closed the event with a promise to remain persistent and quiet the company&#8217;s critics.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;Without a shadow of a doubt, despite the naysayers, the skeptics, we will persist,&#8221; Sampson said. &#8220;We will carry on to make the impossible, possible.&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cem\u003EThis article was updated at 1 a.m ET\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Faraday Future lifted the veil Tuesday on the FF91, an Internet-connected autonomous electric vehicle it describes as the birth of a new breed. The lingering question is whether it can make and deliver this vehicle to the marketplace."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["For $5,000, consumers can earn a priority place in the reservation line for this \"new species,\" an all-electric vehicle that will get an estimated 378 miles on a single charge and is expected to be delivered in 2018."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Those who pony up the refundable deposit will be eligible to upgrade their reservation this spring to the FF 91 Alliance Edition, 300 personalized models that will have an edition-exclusive, paint color. Reserving a standard non-priority spot is free."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The event itself was filled with much of the pomp and circumstance that garnered the startup so much criticism last year when it ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2016\u002F01\u002F05\u002Ffaraday-future-ces\u002F"},"content":["showed off its concept vehicle"]}," at an event ahead of CES, the annual consumer electronics show in Las Vegas."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":{"style":"text-align:center;"},"content":[]},{"tag":"video","attributes":{"videoid":"4685908468001","controls":"1"},"content":[]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Faraday Future returned to CES this year, and found some redemption. The startup showed a vehicle that could actually drive\u2014including a live pseudo-drag race demo onstage\u2014and park itself without a human at the wheel."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["There were also a lot of promises. The FF91 was presented as a highly customized vehicle that will recognize passengers as they approach. The 1,050 horsepower vehicle is also equipped with two Internet hotspots to ensure passengers have a constant connection to digital content, contains the \"greatest battery pack density,\" and is the fastest on the road\u2014per the company's track tests. It's a lot; and won't be verified until the vehicle hits the marketplace, if it ever does."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["\"We're not stopping with automotive,\" said Nick Sampson, Faraday Future's senior vice president of R&amp;D and engineering. \"We don't consider ourselves a car company, we're a technology company reformatting the future of mobility.\""]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["There were some missteps as well. The company's primary backer, LeEco founder Jia Yueting, came onstage to demonstrate its autonomous driving, and the FF91 couldn't be convinced to move. Later, the car successfully crept forward to center stage on its own."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":{"style":"text-align:center;"},"content":[{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Fgetdatasheet\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["Get Data Sheet"]},", "]},"Fortune",{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["\u2019s"]},{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":[" technology newsletter."]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Faraday Future describes the FF91 as a production car, which customers can now reserve via their website. Faraday Future isn't expected to begin deliveries until 2018, which could mean anywhere between 12 and 23 months from now."]},{"tag":"caption","attributes":{"id":"attachment_1893871","align":"aligncenter","width":"1024"},"content":[{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"https:\u002F\u002Ffortunedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F01\u002F20170103_200637.jpg"},"content":[{"tag":"img","attributes":{"src":"https:\u002F\u002Ffortunedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F01\u002F20170103_200637.jpg","alt":"20170103_200637","width":"1024","height":"768"},"content":[]}]}," Photo by Kirsten Korosec"]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The reveal follows weeks of teasers and a number of troubling developments, including the ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2016\u002F12\u002F24\u002Ffaraday-future-execs-depart\u002F"},"content":["departure of several key executives"]},", questions of Yueting's access to capital, and the halt of construction ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2016\u002F11\u002F15\u002Ffaraday-future-factory-electric-car\u002F"},"content":["on its factory"]}," in North Las Vegas."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["None of these problems were mentioned, of course. Once Again Hit By Fresh Profit Padding Allegations"},"content":{"plain":"Toshiba tosbf shares fell more than 5% in early trade on Wednesday after media reported the security watchdog suspects the Japanese conglomerate of misreporting profits by 40 billion yen ($339.59 million) over three years. The revelations add to a series of accounting troubles swirling around Toshiba, which was downgraded by ratings agencies last week after it admitted it may face a multi-billion dollar writedown over its U.S. nuclear business. The Asahi Shimbun newspaper reported on Tuesday, when Tokyo markets were closed, that the Securities and Exchange Surveillance Commission would present allegations of accounting fraud to prosecutors, who had previously declined to investigate due to a lack of evidence. The watchdog found that Toshiba had reported profit gains in its computer operations during the 2012-2014 financial years, when the section had not generated any profit, the newspaper reported, citing unidentified sources. Toshiba&#8217;s two CEOs and a chairman at the helm of the company during that period were involved in the alleged cheating, it added. The investigation could open the way to formal criminal charges against the company and its former executives. Officials at Toshiba were not immediately available for comment. Toshiba shares traded at 288.40 yen, up 1.9%, at 01:38 GMT, after sliding to 263.05 yen in earlier trade. They have tumbled 35% since last week.","rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EToshiba \u003Cspan class=\"tickershortcode quotecard_hook unprocessed neutral\" data-symbol=\"tosbf\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan type=\"text\u002Fjavascript\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\tbrightcove.createExperiences();\n\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fscript\u003E","caption":"It has to do with its nuclear power expansion.\r\n","description":"","title":"Here\u2019s Why Toshiba\u2019s Stock Is Tumbling"},"structured":[{"tag":"video","attributes":{"videoid":"5261879286001","controls":"1"},"content":[]}]}],"fortune:primary_tag":[{"term_id":62352,"name":"toshiba","slug":"toshiba","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":136409,"taxonomy":"post_tag","description":"","parent":0,"count":24,"filter":"raw"}],"fortune:primary_section":[{"term_id":318,"name":"Tech","slug":"tech","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":46728,"taxonomy":"category","description":"News, analysis, and insight into technology and business, including Silicon Valley giants like Apple, Google, Facebook, and our annual Brainstorm Tech conference.","parent":0,"count":36555,"filter":"raw"}]}},{"id":1893668,"date":"2017-01-03T20:10:59","date_gmt":"2017-01-04T01:10:59","guid":{"rendered":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F?p=1893668"},"paid":false,"modified":"2017-01-03T20:17:12","modified_gmt":"2017-01-04T01:17:12","slug":"xerox-spinoff-conduent-ashok-vemuri","type":"post","subtype":"article","link":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2017\u002F01\u002F03\u002Fxerox-spinoff-conduent-ashok-vemuri\u002F","shortlink":"http:\u002F\u002Ffor.tn\u002F2hOIMqZ","dunce":"8432334743","title":{"rendered":"Conduent CEO Talks Splitting From Xerox and Competing with IBM and HPE"},"content":{"plain":"It&#8217;s a new beginning for Xerox&#8217;s spawn. Xerox&#8217;s sibling business services unit, Conduent, spun off into a separate company on Tuesday. It must now find a way to lift its growth amid stagnant sales and a tough market. Xerox acquired the roots of Conduent, which handles everything from human resources services for healthcare companies to mobile parking apps for the city of Los Angeles, by buying Affiliated Computer Services for nearly $6.4 billion in 2010. The deal was supposed to help Xerox find another source of revenue beyond it&#8217;s core copier and printing business. But like other big business tech companies like IBM and Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Xerox&#8217;s overall revenue has declined in recent years. With few people printing and copying, Xerox&#8217;s annual sales have dropped each year since 2011. During much of that time, Xerox&#8217;s business services group struggled. In a nine-month period ending in September, Conduent had $4.9 billion in revenue, or nearly flat compared to the previous year. Xerox&#8217;s executives say that two smaller, more nimble businesses will be able to better adapt to a rapidly changing technology world. The argument echoes that of Hewlett Packard, which split into two companies last year. But Wall Street didn&#8217;t exactly give Conduent a happy birthday. In its first day of trading, the company&#8217;s shares fell 8% to $13.72. In this edited interview with Fortune, Conduent CEO Ashok Vemuri talks about splitting from Xerox xrx , competing with IBM ibm and HPE hpe , and new beginnings. Fortune: Tell me about splitting from Xerox. Vemuri: If you go back six to seven years when Xerox acquired a company called ACS [Affiliated Computer Services] in 2010, the thesis of that acquisition was that Xerox was a hardware manufacturing company. This was during a recession, and management thought the best would be to serve your clients soup-to-nuts, if you will, by acquiring a services company. It was very similar to other companies\u2014think Dell with Perot [$3.9 billion deal was announced in 2009], HP with EDS [$13.9 billion deal was announced in 2008] That construct of combining hardware with services didn\u2019t necessarily pan out. So, it was thought that our two companies would be better served if they were sliced off and were allowed to control their own destiny and serve their own clients, their own market, their own technology, etc. Get Data Sheet, Fortune\u2019s technology newsletter. Why did hardware companies think that they also had to have business services? It was the height of the recession. This was considered a sort of natural hedge in terms of buying revenue. Secondly, it was believed that if you sold a piece of equipment to a client, they were servicing that equipment with somebody else. So why would I not, if I sold you that equipment, service it instead? Thirdly, services companies were on the ascendancy. Remember, even 10 years ago, print, paper, ink was on decline, and it continues to be so. The services business is where the margins are\u2014where the cash flow is\u2014and your need for spending is much less. If you look at an equipment provider like Xerox, it\u2019s more a finance operating lease company, because they fund your purchase of a printer. A services business is asset light. It does not require you to invest your balance sheet in a big way. Some analysts believe the downside of a service company, however, are the costs of hiring employees, which can eat into profitability. That\u2019s wrong. That is the conventional way of thinking about services businesses. In our model, 80% of our business is transactions based. We do everything off the back of technology. That allows me to add a multitude of services off a particular platform. Let me give you an example. If I have three or four clients, I cannot repurpose my people because they aren\u2019t fungible. I can\u2019t say, \u201cHey, for two hours you be on the call center, for two hours you do transaction processing, for two hours you work for Client A, and for two hours you work for Client B.\u201d But I can do it if I do it on the back of technology, because my platform aggregates and creates air pockets that allow me to work for multiple clients. I can repurpose my platform to do multiple functions. With people, I can\u2019t expect them to work more than eight hours. What are the services that your company does? We serve two broad segments. One is the public sector. We work with all 50 U.S. states and over 500 government entities worldwide. We do a lot of work in transportation. Think about parking: You use a parking app pay over the phone, and the phone reminds you after 45 minutes to pay more We are now handling road tolls\u2014so think EasyPass in California and SunPass in Florida. We are the world\u2019s largest prepaid card processor. We do things like welfare, Social Security, Food Stamps. The other part of the business is commercial. We work with 74 of the top Fortune 100 companies. We support them on mission-critical systems. Apple aapl co-founder Steve Jobs once publicly criticized Xerox for not capitalizing on its technology. Correct. In a similar way, a lot of Conduent\u2019s technology was invented in Xerox over the last six years. The ACS story is six years old; a little is left, but a lot of that is new and a lot of that was invented in Xerox. Now that you\u2019re an independent company, how do you balance spending on research into new technologies with pleasing investors? Clearly today, technology is at a place where you don\u2019t necessarily have to build components in-house; you can buy them from others. We have to rid ourselves of the sensibility we\u2019ve had that if it\u2019s not invented in-house it\u2019s not worth looking at. We are now a public company, so our research dollars have to give a return in the year that I give the dollar in, unlike in the past in which the time to yield was like five to seven years. Having said that, technology will be the underpinning of every process we bring. Therefore we must invest in our technology platform and make it modern. The speed of technology is changing and the way it is being consumed is dramatically changing in such a short time frame that our investments have to reflect that time horizon as well as the fact that these changes are happening. Who are your biggest competitors? We are in a wide range of industries, so we have a lot of them. A lot of them are very niche and specialized companies. Across our various businesses, we see as competitors like Accenture, we see IBM, we see HPE. My advantage is I\u2019m a pure-play business process provider. I\u2019m the largest in revenue and in size and scale. For more about enterprise technology, watch: How do you distinguish yourselves from the big business services groups of companies like IBM that may brag that their technology separates them from the pack? Technology is a commodity. I can buy technology every other day at half the price I paid the day before yesterday. The technology product isn\u2019t going to give you any differentiation. What gives you differentiation is what you do with that technology. If I understand processes and have functional and domain knowledge, then I can actually leverage that technology and literally make it jump through hoops to provide me the answer or the outcome that the business really needs.","rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EIt&#8217;s a new beginning for Xerox&#8217;s spawn.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EXerox&#8217;s sibling business services unit, Conduent, spun off into a separate company on Tuesday. It must now find a way to lift its growth amid stagnant sales and a tough market.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EXerox acquired the roots of Conduent, which handles everything from human resources services for healthcare companies to \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2016\u002F01\u002F28\u002Fxerox-los-angeles-traffic\u002F\"\u003Emobile parking apps\u003C\u002Fa\u003E for the city of Los Angeles, by \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.xerox.com\u002Fnews\u002Fnews-archive\u002F2009\u002Fswe-acquire-affiliated-computer-services\u002Fsvse.html\"\u003Ebuying\u003C\u002Fa\u003E Affiliated Computer Services for nearly $6.4 billion in 2010. With few people printing and copying, Xerox&#8217;s annual sales have \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.democratandchronicle.com\u002Fstory\u002Fmoney\u002Fbusiness\u002F2017\u002F01\u002F03\u002Fxerox-conduent-split-complete\u002F96100654\u002F\"\u003Edropped\u003C\u002Fa\u003E each year since 2011.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EDuring much of that time, Xerox&#8217;s business services group struggled. The argument echoes that of Hewlett Packard, which \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2015\u002F11\u002F02\u002Fhewlett-packard-split-infrastructure\u002F\"\u003Esplit into two companies\u003C\u002Fa\u003E last year.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EBut Wall Street didn&#8217;t exactly give Conduent a happy birthday. In its first day of trading, the company's shares fell 8% to $13.72."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["In this edited interview with ",{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["Fortune"]},", Conduent CEO Ashok Vemuri talks about splitting from Xerox ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"xrx"},"content":[]},", competing with IBM ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"ibm"},"content":[]}," and HPE ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"hpe"},"content":[]},", and new beginnings."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"strong","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["Fortune"]},": Tell me about splitting from Xerox."]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Vemuri: If you go back six to seven years when ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fxerox-150\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["Xerox"]}," acquired a company called ACS [Affiliated Computer Services] in 2010, the thesis of that acquisition was that Xerox was a hardware manufacturing company. This was during a recession, and management thought the best would be to serve your clients soup-to-nuts, if you will, by acquiring a services company."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["It was very similar to other companies\u2014think Dell ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2015\u002F12\u002F24\u002Fdell-perot-systems-acquisition\u002F"},"content":["with Perot"]}," [$3.9 billion deal was ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.google.com\u002Fsearch?q=dell+buys+perot&amp;ie=utf-8&amp;oe=utf-8"},"content":["announced"]}," in 2009], ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fhp-20\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["HP"]}," ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2015\u002F09\u002F16\u002Freal-reason-for-hps-woes\u002F"},"content":["with EDS"]}," [$13.9 billion deal was ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww8.hp.com\u002Fus\u002Fen\u002Fhp-news\u002Fpress-release.html?id=169924#.WGxJPnCTtGA"},"content":["announced"]}," in 2008] That construct of combining hardware with services didn\u2019t necessarily pan out. So, it was thought that our two companies would be better served if they were sliced off and were allowed to control their own destiny and serve their own clients, their own market, their own technology, etc."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":{"style":"text-align:center;"},"content":[{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Fgetdatasheet\u002F"},"content":["Get Data Sheet"]},", Fortune\u2019s technology newsletter."]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"strong","attributes":[],"content":["Why did hardware companies think that they also had to have business services?"]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["It was the height of the recession. This was considered a sort of natural hedge in terms of buying revenue. Secondly, it was believed that if you sold a piece of equipment to a client, they were servicing that equipment with somebody else. So why would I not, if I sold you that equipment, service it instead? Thirdly, services companies were on the ascendancy. Remember, even 10 years ago, print, paper, ink was on decline, and it continues to be so. The services business is where the margins are\u2014where the cash flow is\u2014and your need for spending is much less. If you look at an equipment provider like Xerox, it\u2019s more a finance operating lease company, because they fund your purchase of a printer. A services business is asset light. It does not require you to invest your balance sheet in a big way."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"strong","attributes":[],"content":["Some analysts believe the downside of a service company, however, are the costs of hiring employees, which can eat into profitability.",{"tag":"br","attributes":[],"content":[]}]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["That\u2019s wrong. That is the conventional way of thinking about services businesses. In our model, 80% of our business is transactions based. We do everything off the back of technology. That allows me to add a multitude of services off a particular platform. Let me give you an example. If I have three or four clients, I cannot repurpose my people because they aren\u2019t fungible. I can\u2019t say, \u201cHey, for two hours you be on the call center, for two hours you do transaction processing, for two hours you work for Client A, and for two hours you work for Client B.\u201d But I can do it if I do it on the back of technology, because my platform aggregates and creates air pockets that allow me to work for multiple clients. I can repurpose my platform to do multiple functions. With people, I can\u2019t expect them to work more than eight hours."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"strong","attributes":[],"content":["What are the services that your company does?"]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["We serve two broad segments. One is the public sector. We work with all 50 U.S. states and over 500 government entities worldwide. We do a lot of work in transportation. Think about parking: You use a parking app pay over the phone, and the phone reminds you after 45 minutes to pay more We are now handling road tolls\u2014so think ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.actransit.org\u002Frider-info\u002Feasypass\u002F"},"content":["EasyPass"]}," in California and ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.sunpass.com\u002Findex"},"content":["SunPass"]}," in Florida."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["We are the world\u2019s largest prepaid card processor. We do things like welfare, Social Security, Food Stamps. The other part of the business is commercial. We work with 74 of the top ",{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["Fortune"]}," 100 companies. We support them on mission-critical systems."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"strong","attributes":[],"content":["Apple ",{"tag":"stock","attributes":{"symbol":"aapl"},"content":[]}," co-founder Steve Jobs once publicly ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.youtube.com\u002Fwatch?v=X3NASGb5m8s"},"content":["criticized"]}," Xerox for not capitalizing on its technology."]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Correct. In a similar way, a lot of Conduent\u2019s technology was invented in Xerox over the last six years. The ACS story is six years old; a little is left, but a lot of that is new and a lot of that was invented in Xerox."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"strong","attributes":[],"content":["Now that you\u2019re an independent company, how do you balance spending on research into ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2016\u002F11\u002F28\u002Fhewlett-packard-enterprise-machine-computing\u002F"},"content":["new technologies"]}," with pleasing investors?"]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Clearly today, technology is at a place where you don\u2019t necessarily have to build components in-house; you can buy ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2016\u002F11\u002F18\u002Fred-hat-ceo-james-whitehurst-microsoft-google-software\u002F"},"content":["them from others"]},". We have to rid ourselves of the sensibility we\u2019ve had that if it\u2019s not invented in-house it\u2019s not worth looking at. We are now a public company, so our research dollars have to give a return in the year that I give the dollar in, unlike in the past in which the time to yield was like five to seven years."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Having said that, technology will be the underpinning of every process we bring. Therefore we must invest in our technology platform and make it modern. The speed of technology is changing and the way it is being consumed is dramatically changing in such a short time frame that our investments have to reflect that time horizon as well as the fact that these changes are happening."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"strong","attributes":[],"content":["Who are your biggest competitors?"]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["We are in a wide range of industries, so we have a lot of them. A lot of them are very niche and specialized companies. Across our various businesses, we see as competitors like Accenture, we see ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fibm-31\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["IBM"]},", we see HPE. My advantage is I\u2019m a pure-play business process provider. I\u2019m the largest in revenue and in size and scale."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":{"style":"text-align:center;"},"content":[{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["For more about enterprise technology, watch:"]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":{"style":"text-align:center;"},"content":[]},{"tag":"video","attributes":{"videoid":"4728445300001","controls":"1"},"content":[]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"strong","attributes":[],"content":["How do you distinguish yourselves from the big business services groups of companies like IBM that may brag that their technology separates them from the pack?"]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Technology is a commodity. Photographer: Michael Nagle\u002FBloomberg via Getty Images","title":"Conduent 2017"},"video":null,"structured":null}],"fortune:primary_tag":[{"term_id":42751983,"name":"PointCloud","slug":"pointcloud","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":143855,"taxonomy":"post_tag","description":"","parent":0,"count":578,"filter":"raw"}],"fortune:primary_section":[{"term_id":318,"name":"Tech","slug":"tech","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":46728,"taxonomy":"category","description":"News, analysis, and insight into technology and business, including Silicon Valley giants like Apple, Google, Facebook, and our annual Brainstorm Tech conference.","parent":0,"count":36555,"filter":"raw"}]}},{"id":1893406,"date":"2017-01-03T20:00:54","date_gmt":"2017-01-04T01:00:54","guid":{"rendered":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F?p=1893406"},"paid":false,"modified":"2017-01-03T20:00:56","modified_gmt":"2017-01-04T01:00:56","slug":"loreal-smart-hairbrush-ces","type":"post","subtype":"article","link":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2017\u002F01\u002F03\u002Floreal-smart-hairbrush-ces\u002F","shortlink":"http:\u002F\u002Ffor.tn\u002F2hPbXsv","dunce":"8432334743","title":{"rendered":"L\u2019Oreal\u2019s \u2018Smart\u2019 Hairbrush Wants to Help Solve a Huge Beauty Problem"},"content":{"plain":"L&#8217;Oreal thinks your hairbrush could be a little smarter. The French cosmetics and beauty giant this week will debut a connected smart hairbrush called the Krastase Hair Coach at CES 2017 in Las Vegas. The device is a brush that comes with sensors that L&#8217;Oreal promises will measure the quality of a user&#8217;s hair as well as the effects of different hair care routines. The gadget will retail for &#8220;under $200&#8221; and will be available this fall at Krastase hair salons as well as online. &#8220;We really want to think about what the connected bathroom will look like in the future for the beauty industry,&#8221; Guive Balooch, VP of L&#8217;Oreal&#8217;s Technology Incubator, told Fortune in an interview. The Krastase Hair Coach\u2014with technology powered by Nokia-owned Withings\u2014features a microphone (which listens to the sound of brushing to identify patterns); an accelerometer and a gyroscope (to analyze brushing patterns and count brush strokes); and sensors (to determine if the the brush is being used on dry or wet hair). Via connection with an app, the brush can tell a user how how often hair is brushed\u2014and also warn consumers if they are brushing too hard. The brush vibrates to warn against over brushing. Balooch says the brush also gives a user a daily hair breakage score\u2014by measuring the overall quality of the hair. The device then provides tips based on the user&#8217;s hair type and brushing behavior (and of course, makes a few helpful recommendations for Krastase beauty products). &#8220;It will basically be your hair coach,&#8221; Balooch said. &#8220;When you brush you hair, it will do a good job to make sure your hair is smooth.&#8221; The smart hairbrush is the latest device from L&#8217;Oreal as the beauty behemoth behind Garnier, Maybelline and Kiehl&#8217;s thinks about how it can infuse technology into those well-established consumer brands. L&#8217;Oreal itself set up an internal, tech-focused startup several years ago in Silicon Valley and has recently made investments in external digital and technology startups. One of the incubator&#8217;s first products, a stretchable skin sensor designed to monitor ultraviolet light exposure called My UV Patch, debuted at CES last year. Of course, all this raises the obvious question: do bathrooms across the globe really need a &#8220;smart&#8221; hairbrush? Most can likely live without it\u2014but at CES, a slew of Internet-connected home devices debut each year as inventors envision a world where sensors invade more aspects of our day-to-day lives. The idea is that data from these sensors can improve or lives. Many of these devices are increasingly targeting the home\u2014L&#8217;Oreal is specifically focusing on the bathroom. Balooch says his team&#8217;s goal is to hone in on real needs and provide data and information to improve a consumer&#8217;s routine. Hair breakage is a top beauty concern for women as it relates to their hair\u2014so helping them avoid split ends is a need that L&#8217;Oreal thinks it can meet with the smart hairbrush. L&#8217;Oreal says the goal is for the app and device to work as simply as possible. &#8220;It needs to connect to something they already have in their day-to-day routine,&#8221; Balooch said. When it comes to L&#8217;Oreal&#8217;s CES product debuts, it also must comb through the company&#8217;s deep bench of brands to figure out what makes most sense for the branding name to attach to the technology. Dermatological skincare brand La Roche-Posay got the nod for last year&#8217;s My UV Patch, while for 2017, hair care products brand Krastase was selected because it has a luxurious connotation among consumers.","rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EL&#8217;Oreal thinks your hairbrush could be a little smarter.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe French cosmetics and beauty giant this week will debut a connected smart hairbrush called the Krastase Hair Coach at CES 2017 in Las Vegas. The device is a brush that comes with sensors that L&#8217;Oreal promises will measure the quality of a user&#8217;s hair as well as the effects of different hair care routines. The gadget will retail for &#8220;under $200&#8221; and will be available this fall at Krastase hair salons as well as online.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;We really want to think about what the connected bathroom will look like in the future for the beauty industry,&#8221; Guive Balooch, VP of L&#8217;Oreal&#8217;s Technology Incubator, told \u003Cem\u003EFortune\u003C\u002Fem\u003E in an interview.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe Krastase Hair Coach\u2014with technology powered by Nokia-owned \u003Cspan class=\"st\"\u003EWithings\u2014features a microphone (which listens to the sound of brushing to identify patterns); an accelerometer and a gyroscope (to analyze brushing patterns and count brush strokes); and sensors (to determine if the the brush is being used on dry or wet hair). Via connection with an app, the brush can tell a user how how often hair is brushed\u2014and also warn consumers if they are brushing too hard. The brush vibrates to warn against over brushing.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"video-wrapper\"  data-ratio=\"0.56363636363636\" data-pos=\"7\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003Cobject id=\"bc-video-5216220085001-7\" class=\"BrightcoveExperience\"\u003E\u003Cparam name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\"\u002F\u003E\u003Cparam name=\"width\" measuring the overall quality of the hair. The device then provides tips based on the user&#8217;s hair type and brushing behavior (and of course, makes a few helpful recommendations for Krastase beauty products).\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;It will basically be your hair coach,&#8221; Balooch said. &#8220;When you brush you hair, it will do a good job to make sure your hair is smooth.&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2 _10M0Ygc4\"\u003EThe smart hairbrush is the latest device from L&#8217;Oreal as the beauty behemoth behind Garnier, Maybelline and Kiehl&#8217;s thinks about how it can infuse technology into those well-established consumer brands. L&#8217;Oreal itself set up an internal, tech-focused startup several years ago in Silicon Valley and has \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2016\u002F12\u002F27\u002Floreal-digital-startups\u002F\"\u003Erecently made investments\u003C\u002Fa\u003E in external digital and technology startups. One of the incubator&#8217;s first products, a stretchable skin sensor designed to monitor ultraviolet light exposure called \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002F2016\u002F01\u002F06\u002Floreal-wearable-sun-exposure\u002F\"\u003EMy UV Patch\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, debuted at CES last year.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EOf course, all this raises the obvious question: do bathrooms across the globe really need a &#8220;smart&#8221; hairbrush? Most can likely live without it\u2014but at CES, a slew of Internet-connected home devices debut each year as inventors envision a world where sensors invade more aspects of our day-to-day lives. The idea is that data from these sensors can improve or lives. Many of these devices are increasingly targeting the home\u2014L&#8217;Oreal is specifically focusing on the bathroom.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EBalooch says his team&#8217;s goal is to hone in on real needs and provide data and information to improve a consumer&#8217;s routine. Hair breakage is a top beauty concern for women as it relates to their hair\u2014so helping them avoid split ends is a need that L&#8217;Oreal thinks it can meet with the smart hairbrush. L&#8217;Oreal says the goal is for the app and device to work as simply as possible. &#8220;It needs to connect to something they already have in their day-to-day routine,&#8221; Balooch said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EWhen it comes to L&#8217;Oreal&#8217;s CES product debuts, it also must comb through the company&#8217;s deep bench of brands to figure out what makes most sense for the branding name to attach to the technology. Dermatological skincare brand La Roche-Posay got the nod for last year&#8217;s My UV Patch, while for 2017, hair care products brand Krastase was selected because it has a luxurious connotation among consumers.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["L'Oreal thinks your hairbrush could be a little smarter."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The French cosmetics and beauty giant this week will debut a connected smart hairbrush called the Krastase Hair Coach at CES 2017 in Las Vegas. The device is a brush that comes with sensors that L'Oreal promises will measure the quality of a user's hair as well as the effects of different hair care routines. The gadget will retail for \"under $200\" and will be available this fall at Krastase hair salons as well as online."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["\"We really want to think about what the connected bathroom will look like in the future for the beauty industry,\" Guive Balooch, VP of L'Oreal's Technology Incubator, told ",{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["Fortune"]}," in an interview."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The Krastase Hair Coach\u2014with technology powered by Nokia-owned  Withings\u2014features a microphone (which listens to the sound of brushing to identify patterns); an accelerometer and a gyroscope (to analyze brushing patterns and count brush strokes); and sensors (to determine if the the brush is being used on dry or wet hair). Via connection with an app, the brush can tell a user how how often hair is brushed\u2014and also warn consumers if they are brushing too hard. The brush vibrates to warn against over brushing."]},{"tag":"video","attributes":{"videoid":"5216220085001","controls":"1"},"content":[]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Balooch says the brush also gives a user a daily hair breakage score\u2014by measuring the overall quality of the hair. How Nokia Plans to Invest in Smart Devices"},"content":{"plain":"Nokia made a splash at CES 2017 with help from its smart home subsidiary Withings. The Finnish phone maker on Tuesday announced a few new devices that it says will help its Withings brand, which Nokia NOK acquired in May 2016 for an undisclosed sum, continue to compete in the smart devices market. Chief among those announcements was the new Withings Home Plus, a smart HD camera that can not only record what&#8217;s happening in the home, but also receive notifications in the event of an unusual noise, monitor indoor air quality, and keep a watchful eye on a baby with its baby-monitoring feature. Withings Home Plus can also stream video to a user&#8217;s smartphone. Get Data Sheet, Fortune\u2019s technology newsletter The Home Plus is designed to work with Withings&#8217; own mobile-monitoring app for Android and iOS, but Nokia was quick to point out that the camera is one of the first of its kind to support Apple&#8217;s HomeKit, a service that lets third-party companies integrate control over their products into Apple&#8217;s Home app. The Home app lives on iOS and acts as a central hub for users to control the many smart devices throughout the home. Nokia says that its Withings Home Plus will be available to customers in the first quarter for $199. In addition to the camera, Nokia said that it&#8217;s improving its Withings line of products with the release on Jan. 4 of the Withings Steel HR activity tracker. The Steel HR can track a wearer&#8217;s health by seeing how far they&#8217;ve walked and what kinds of activities they&#8217;ve engaged in, like playing basketball, soccer, or even boxing. The Steel HR can also track heart rate. For more about Nokia, watch: Because the Steel HR is designed to be more than an activity tracker, Nokia says the Withings wearable is also a timepiece with an analog-style watch face to help folks tell time. It integrates with an Android smartphone goog or iPhone aapl to deliver smartphone notifications. The Steel HR will be available 36mm and 40mm sizes, and will retail for a starting price of $200. Nokia says it&#8217;ll initially be on sale through its Withings online store, and will then find its way to retail stores in mid-January. One other tidbit from Nokia&#8217;s CES announcement: a smart hairbrush made by Withings that the company says will improve a user&#8217;s hair care routine and help the person avoid hair damage.","rendered":"\u003Cp\u003ENokia made a splash at CES 2017 with help from its smart home subsidiary Withings.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe Finnish phone maker on Tuesday announced a few new devices that it says will help its Withings brand, which Nokia \u003Cspan class=\"tickershortcode quotecard_hook unprocessed neutral\" data-symbol=\"NOK\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"wrapper trend-wrapper\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003Ca class=\"exit_trigger_set\" href=\"\u002Fcompany\u002Fnok\u002F\"\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"ticker\"\u003ENOK\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003Cspan class=\"change percent\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\n\t\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\n\t\t\t\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E acquired in May 2016 for an undisclosed sum, continue to compete in the smart devices market.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EChief among those announcements was the new Withings Home Plus, a smart HD camera that can not only record what&#8217;s happening in the home, but also receive notifications in the event of an unusual noise, monitor indoor air quality, and keep a watchful eye on a baby with its baby-monitoring feature. Withings Home Plus can also stream video to a user's smartphone."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":{"style":"text-align:center;"},"content":[{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Fgetdatasheet\u002F"},"content":["Get Data Sheet"]},", Fortune\u2019s technology newsletter"]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The Home Plus is designed to work with Withings' own mobile-monitoring app for Android and iOS, but Nokia was quick to point out that the camera is one of the first of its kind to support Apple's HomeKit, a service that lets third-party companies integrate control over their products into Apple's Home app. The Home app lives on iOS and acts as a central hub for users to control the many smart devices throughout the home."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Nokia says that its Withings Home Plus will be available to customers in the first quarter for $199."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["In addition to the camera, Nokia said that it's improving its Withings line of products with the release on Jan. 4 of the Withings Steel HR activity tracker."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The Steel HR can track a wearer's health by seeing how far they've walked and what kinds of activities they've engaged in, like playing basketball, soccer, or even boxing. The Steel HR can also track heart rate."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":{"style":"text-align:center;"},"content":[{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["For more about Nokia, watch:"]}," "]},{"tag":"video","attributes":{"videoid":"5230841484001","controls":"1"},"content":[]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Because the Steel HR is designed to be more than an activity tracker, Nokia says the Withings wearable is also a timepiece with an analog-style watch face to help folks tell time.
